    330  3d41		       05		      .byte.b	5
    331  3d42		       4f		      .byte.b	< PLAYER_RIGHT0

      0  3d59					      DEFINE_SUBROUTINE	TrackPlayer	; =145; in GENERIC_BANK_1
      1  3d59		       00 07	   BANK_TrackPlayer =	_CURRENT_BANK
      2  3d59					      SUBROUTINE
      3  3d59				   TrackPlayer
    376  3d59
    377  3d59		       a5 aa		      lda	LookingAround	; 3
    378  3d5b		       30 cb		      bmi	Ret	; 2/3=5/6   don't track when looking around
    379  3d5d
    380  3d5d							; Contribution by Thomas Jentzsch
    381  3d5d
    382  3d5d							; scrolling constants:
    383  3d5d		       00 03	   .SCRL_START_LEFT =	3	; 3
    384  3d5d		       00 05	   .SCRL_STOP_LEFT =	SCREEN_WIDTH-5	; 5 scrolls 5-3+1 = 3 pixel
    385  3d5d		       00 07	   .SCRL_START_RIGHT =	SCREEN_WIDTH-.SCRL_START_LEFT	; 7
    386  3d5d		       00 05	   .SCRL_STOP_RIGHT =	SCREEN_WIDTH-.SCRL_STOP_LEFT	; 5
    387  3d5d		       00 11	   .SCRL_LEFT_BIT =	%00010001
    388  3d5d		       00 22	   .SCRL_RIGHT_BIT =	%00100010
    389  3d5d		       00 33	   .SCRL_X_BITS =	.SCRL_LEFT_BIT|.SCRL_RIGHT_BIT
    390  3d5d
    391  3d5d		       00 02	   .SCRL_START_UP =	2	; 2
    392  3d5d		       00 03	   .SCRL_STOP_UP =	SCREEN_LINES-5	; 3 scrolls 3-2+1 = 2 pixel
    393  3d5d		       00 06	   .SCRL_START_DOWN =	SCREEN_LINES-.SCRL_START_UP	; 6
    394  3d5d		       00 05	   .SCRL_STOP_DOWN =	SCREEN_LINES-.SCRL_STOP_UP	; 5
    395  3d5d		       00 44	   .SCRL_UP_BIT =	%01000100
    396  3d5d		       00 88	   .SCRL_DOWN_BIT =	%10001000
    397  3d5d		       00 cc	   .SCRL_Y_BITS =	.SCRL_UP_BIT|.SCRL_DOWN_BIT
    398  3d5d
    399  3d5d							; *** horizontal scrolling (unoptimized version): ***
    400  3d5d
    401  3d5d							; check for enabling horizontal scrolling:
    402  3d5d		       a5 9f		      lda	ManX	; 3
    403  3d5f		       38		      sec		; 2
    404  3d60		       e5 9b		      sbc	BoardScrollX	; 3
    405  3d62		       a8		      tay		; 2	     for later use
    406  3d63		       a9 11		      lda	#.SCRL_LEFT_BIT	; 2
    407  3d65		       c0 03		      cpy	#.SCRL_START_LEFT	; 2	     <3?
    408  3d67		       30 06		      bmi	.startXScroll	; 2/3	     yes, scroll left
    409  3d69		       c0 07		      cpy	#.SCRL_START_RIGHT	; 2	     <8?
    410  3d6b		       30 08		      bmi	.skipStartXScroll	; 2/3	     no
    411  3d6d		       a9 22		      lda	#.SCRL_RIGHT_BIT	; 2 = 22    yes, scroll right
    412  3d6f				   .startXScroll
    413  3d6f		       29 03		      and	#.SCRL_X_BITS >> 4	; 2
    414  3d71		       05 9c		      ora	scrollBits	; 3
    415  3d73		       85 9c		      sta	scrollBits	; 3 =	8
    416  3d75				   .skipStartXScroll
    417  3d75
    418  3d75							; do horizontal scrolling:
    419  3d75		       a5 9c		      lda	scrollBits	; 3
    420  3d77		       29 03		      and	#.SCRL_X_BITS >> 4	; 2
    421  3d79		       f0 23		      beq	.skipXScroll	; 2/3
    422  3d7b		       29 22		      and	#.SCRL_RIGHT_BIT	; 2
    423  3d7d		       d0 0c		      bne	.xScrollRight	; 2/3=11/12
    424  3d7f
    425  3d7f							; scroll left:
    426  3d7f		       a5 9b		      lda	BoardScrollX	; 3	     already at left edge?
    427  3d81		       f0 15		      beq	.stopXScroll	; 2
    428  3d83		       c6 9b		      dec	BoardScrollX	; 5
    429  3d85		       c0 04		      cpy	#.SCRL_STOP_LEFT-1	; 2
    430  3d87		       10 0f		      bpl	.stopXScroll	; 2/3=15
    431  3d89		       30 13		      bmi	.skipXScroll	; 3
    432  3d8b							;---------------------------------------
    433  3d8b				   .xScrollRight
    434  3d8b		       a6 9b		      ldx	BoardScrollX	; 3
    435  3d8d		       e8		      inx		; 2
    436  3d8e		       e4 98		      cpx	BoardEdge_Right	; 3	     already at right edge?
    437  3d90		       10 06		      bpl	.stopXScroll	; 2/3
    438  3d92		       86 9b		      stx	BoardScrollX	; 3
    439  3d94		       c0 06		      cpy	#.SCRL_STOP_RIGHT+1	; 2
    440  3d96		       10 06		      bpl	.skipXScroll	; 2/3=17/18
    441  3d98				   .stopXScroll
    442  3d98		       a5 9c		      lda	scrollBits	; 3
    443  3d9a		       29 fc		      and	#(~(.SCRL_X_BITS >> 4))	; 2
    444  3d9c		       85 9c		      sta	scrollBits	; 3 =	8
    445  3d9e				   .skipXScroll
    446  3d9e							; worst case: 22 + 8 + 12 + 17 + 8 = 67
    447  3d9e
    448  3d9e							; *** vertical scrolling (unoptimized version): ***
    449  3d9e
    450  3d9e							; check for enabling vertical scrolling:
    451  3d9e		       a5 a0		      lda	ManY	; 3
    452  3da0		       38		      sec		; 2
    453  3da1		       e5 9a		      sbc	BoardScrollY	; 3
    454  3da3		       a8		      tay		; 2	     for later use
    455  3da4		       a9 44		      lda	#.SCRL_UP_BIT	; 2
    456  3da6		       c0 02		      cpy	#.SCRL_START_UP	; 2	     <2?
    457  3da8		       30 06		      bmi	.startYScroll	; 2/3	     yes, scroll up
    458  3daa		       c0 06		      cpy	#.SCRL_START_DOWN	; 2	     <6?
    459  3dac		       30 08		      bmi	.skipStartYScroll	; 2/3
    460  3dae		       a9 88		      lda	#.SCRL_DOWN_BIT	; 2 = 22    yes, scroll down
    461  3db0				   .startYScroll
    462  3db0		       29 0c		      and	#.SCRL_Y_BITS >> 4	; 2
    463  3db2		       05 9c		      ora	scrollBits	; 3
    464  3db4		       85 9c		      sta	scrollBits	; 3 =	8
    465  3db6				   .skipStartYScroll
    466  3db6
    467  3db6							; do vertical scrolling:
    468  3db6		       a5 9c		      lda	scrollBits	; 3
    469  3db8		       29 cc		      and	#.SCRL_Y_BITS	; 2
    470  3dba		       f0 23		      beq	.skipYScroll	; 2/3
    471  3dbc		       29 88		      and	#.SCRL_DOWN_BIT	; 2
    472  3dbe		       d0 0c		      bne	.yScrollDown	; 2/3=11/12
    473  3dc0
    474  3dc0							; scroll up
    475  3dc0		       a5 9a		      lda	BoardScrollY	; 3
    476  3dc2		       f0 15		      beq	.stopYScroll	; 2
    477  3dc4		       c6 9a		      dec	BoardScrollY	; 5
    478  3dc6		       c0 02		      cpy	#.SCRL_STOP_UP-1	; 2
    479  3dc8		       10 0f		      bpl	.stopYScroll	; 2/3=15
    480  3dca		       30 13		      bmi	.skipYScroll	; 3
    481  3dcc							;---------------------------------------
    482  3dcc				   .yScrollDown
    483  3dcc		       a6 9a		      ldx	BoardScrollY	; 3
    484  3dce		       e8		      inx		; 2
    485  3dcf		       e4 99		      cpx	BoardEdge_Bottom	;     ; 3
    486  3dd1		       10 06		      bpl	.stopYScroll	; 2/3
    487  3dd3		       86 9a		      stx	BoardScrollY	; 3
    488  3dd5		       c0 06		      cpy	#.SCRL_STOP_DOWN+1	; 2
    489  3dd7		       10 06		      bpl	.skipYScroll	; 2/3=17/18
    490  3dd9				   .stopYScroll
    491  3dd9		       a5 9c		      lda	scrollBits	; 3
    492  3ddb		       29 f3		      and	#(~(.SCRL_Y_BITS >> 4))	; 2
    493  3ddd		       85 9c		      sta	scrollBits	; 3 =	8
    494  3ddf				   .skipYScroll
    495  3ddf							; worst case: 22 + 8 + 12 + 17 + 8 = 67
    496  3ddf
    497  3ddf		       60	   EarlyAbortx rts		; 6 =	6
    498  3de0							; total: 5+67*2+6 = 145
    499  3de0
    500  3de0							;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
    501  3de0
    502  3de0
    503  3de0
    504  3de0							; worst case time from positive last check to rts: 123
    505  3de0							; cycles until 0-check: 15
    506  3de0							; minimum cycles available after last positive check until timer turns 0: (MINIMUM_SORT_TIME-1)*64+1
    507  3de0							; MINIMUM_SORT_TIME = 3 = 129
    508  3de0							; MINIMUM_SORT_TIME = 4 = 193 <- ok
    509  3de0
    510  3de0							;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
    511  3de0

    518  3de0							;		  sta TS_Vector+1		  ; 3
    519  3de0

    521  3de0							;sta ROM_Bank			  ; 4	     GUESS!  SEEMS TO RUN OK WITHOUT THIS.
    522  3de0							;		  rts				  ; 6
    523  3de0

    527  3de0
      0  3de0					      DEFINE_SUBROUTINE	TS_PhaseVectorLO
      1  3de0		       00 07	   BANK_TS_PhaseVectorLO =	_CURRENT_BANK
      2  3de0					      SUBROUTINE
      3  3de0				   TS_PhaseVectorLO
    529  3de0
    530  3de0							; Gives LO byte of addresses of subroutines for timeslice processing
    531  3de0
    532  3de0		       a9		      .byte.b	<ProcessObjStack
    533  3de1		       ef		      .byte.b	<ProcessBlankStack
    534  3de2		       e9		      .byte.b	<DrawFullScreen
    535  3de3		       20		      .byte.b	<BuildDrawStack
    536  3de4		       27		      .byte.b	<DrawAIntoStack
    537  3de5		       06		      .byte.b	<SwitchObjects
    538  3de6
    539  3de6				   TS_PhaseVectorHI
    540  3de6
    541  3de6							; Gives HI byte of addresses of subroutines for timeslice processing
    542  3de6
    543  3de6		       f8		      .byte.b	>ProcessObjStack
    544  3de7		       f8		      .byte.b	>ProcessBlankStack
    545  3de8		       f3		      .byte.b	>DrawFullScreen
    546  3de9		       fb		      .byte.b	>BuildDrawStack
    547  3dea		       fb		      .byte.b	>DrawAIntoStack
    548  3deb		       f9		      .byte.b	>SwitchObjects
    549  3dec
    550  3dec				   TS_PhaseBank
    551  3dec
    552  3dec							; Gives bank of subroutines for timeslice processing
    553  3dec
    554  3dec		       0f		      .byte.b	BANK_ProcessObjStack
    555  3ded		       0f		      .byte.b	BANK_ProcessBlankStack
    556  3dee		       08		      .byte.b	BANK_DrawFullScreen
    557  3def		       08		      .byte.b	BANK_DRAW_BUFFERS	;BANK_BuildDrawStack
    558  3df0		       08		      .byte.b	BANK_DRAW_BUFFERS	;BANK_BuildDrawStack2
    559  3df1		       0f		      .byte.b	BANK_SwitchObjects
    560  3df2
    561  3df2							;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
    562  3df2		       02 02	   lookColour2 .byte.b	$02, $02
    563  3df4		       04 04		      .byte.b	$04, $04
    564  3df6
    565  3df6				   OverscanTime
    566  3df6		       33 33		      .byte.b	OVERSCAN_TIM_NTSC, OVERSCAN_TIM_NTSC
    567  3df8		       46 33		      .byte.b	OVERSCAN_TIM_PAL, OVERSCAN_TIM_NTSC
    568  3dfa
    569  3dfa
    570  3dfa
    571  3dfa
      0  3dfa					      DEFINE_SUBROUTINE	PostScreenCleanup
      1  3dfa		       00 07	   BANK_PostScreenCleanup =	_CURRENT_BANK
      2  3dfa					      SUBROUTINE
      3  3dfa				   PostScreenCleanup
    573  3dfa
    574  3dfa		       c8		      iny		; --> 0
    575  3dfb
    576  3dfb		       84 49		      sty	COLUBK	; starts colour change bottom score area, wraps to top score area
    577  3dfd							; + moved here so we don't see a minor colour artefact bottom of screen when look-arounding
    578  3dfd
    579  3dfd		       84 4d		      sty	PF0	; why wasn't this here?  I saw colour glitching in score area!
    580  3dff							; TJ: no idea why, but you had removed it in revision 758 ;)
    581  3dff							; completely accidental -- one of our cats may have deleted it.
    582  3dff		       84 4e		      sty	PF1
    583  3e01		       84 4f		      sty	PF2
    584  3e03		       84 5d		      sty	ENAM0
    585  3e05		       84 5b		      sty	GRP0	; when look-scrolling, we can see feet at the top if these aren't here
    586  3e07		       84 5c		      sty	GRP1	; 30/12/2011 -- fix dots @ top!
    587  3e09
    588  3e09
    589  3e09
    590  3e09							; D1 VBLANK turns off beam
    591  3e09							; It needs to be turned on 37 scanlines later
    592  3e09
    593  3e09		       a9 42		      lda	#%01000010	; bit6 is not required
    594  3e0b		       85 41		      sta	VBLANK	; end of screen - enter blanking
    595  3e0d
    596  3e0d							;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
    597  3e0d							; This is where the PAL system has a bit of extra time on a per-frame basis.
    598  3e0d
    599  3e0d		       a6 81		      ldx	Platform
    600  3e0f		       bd f6 f5 	      lda	OverscanTime,x
    601  3e12		       8d 96 02 	      sta	TIM64T
    602  3e15
    603  3e15							; Background colour priorities. Increasing order of priority...
    604  3e15							;	black -- nothing happening
    605  3e15							;	looking around			     lookingAround<0		     BLUE
    606  3e15							;	when paused			     gameMode... BIT7		     RED
    607  3e15							;	when the door opens (flash)	     ColourTimer>0		     WHITE
    608  3e15
    609  3e15
    610  3e15		       a5 aa		      lda	LookingAround
    611  3e17		       10 02		      bpl	nolooker	; if not looking around, that will do nicely
    612  3e19		       a0 02		      ldy	#2	;sok
    613  3e1b							;		  ldy lookColour2,x		  ; otherwise, use the lookaround colour as the base
    614  3e1b		       84 af	   nolooker   sty	BGColour	; 'BASE' colour pause reverts TO when unpaused
    615  3e1d
    616  3e1d		       a5 b4		      lda	ThrottleSpeed
    617  3e1f		       18		      clc
    618  3e20		       65 b3		      adc	Throttle
    619  3e22		       b0 02		      bcs	noVerflo
    620  3e24		       85 b3		      sta	Throttle
    621  3e26				   noVerflo
    622  3e26
    623  3e26
    624  3e26							;----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
    625  3e26							; handle pause button for 2600 and 7800
    626  3e26
    627  3e26							; Timings:  NOT including palette setting or platform detect
    628  3e26							; 2600:     no button press:	 11 cycles
    629  3e26							;	     with button press:  21 cycles
    630  3e26							; 7800      no button press:	 16 cycles
    631  3e26							;	     with button press:  21 cycles
    632  3e26
    633  3e26
    634  3e26
    635  3e26		       00 08	   BW_SWITCH  =	$08	; NOTE: Shares bit position with SWCHB COLOUR/B&W SWITCH
    636  3e26
    637  3e26		       24 80		      bit	gameMode
    638  3e28		       50 0b		      bvc	.pause7800	; 7800 platform
    639  3e2a
    640  3e2a							; 2600 pause logic...
    641  3e2a
    642  3e2a		       ad 82 02 	      lda	SWCHB
    643  3e2d		       45 80		      eor	gameMode
    644  3e2f		       29 08		      and	#BW_SWITCH
    645  3e31		       f0 17		      beq	.setPauseCol	; no different to original state = no pause change
    646  3e33		       d0 0f		      bne	.buttonDown	; unconditional
    647  3e35
    648  3e35							; 7800 pause logic...
    649  3e35
    650  3e35							; When the button is pressed, we check if it's the FIRST time it's pressed.
    651  3e35							; This FIRST time is indicated by the PFLAG7800 being clear.  If it's the first time, we toggle the pause
    652  3e35							; flag (BIT6) AND we toggle the PFLAG7800 so continued button-down does nothing.  When the button is
    653  3e35							; released, then we again toggle the PFLAG7800, allowing a FIRST time check once again, when the button
    654  3e35							; is next pressed.
    655  3e35
    656  3e35		       a9 08	   .pause7800 lda	#BW_SWITCH
    657  3e37		       2c 82 02 	      bit	SWCHB
    658  3e3a		       f0 04		      beq	.pausePress
    659  3e3c		       05 80		      ora	gameMode	; not pressed, so enable first time press
    660  3e3e		       d0 08		      bne	.fixPause	; unconditional
    661  3e40
    662  3e40		       24 80	   .pausePress bit	gameMode
    663  3e42		       f0 06		      beq	.setPauseCol	; NOT the first time in pause - so do nothing new
    664  3e44
    665  3e44							; Button is down, and we have detected it as a FIRST-TIME button press.
    666  3e44
    667  3e44		       45 80	   .buttonDown eor	gameMode	; toggle first time flag(7800) or current switch state(2600)
    668  3e46		       49 80		      eor	#GAMEMODE_PAUSED	; toggle pause flag
    669  3e48		       85 80	   .fixPause  sta	gameMode
    670  3e4a
    671  3e4a		       a5 80	   .setPauseCol lda	gameMode	; are we paused?
    672  3e4c		       10 07		      bpl	.exitPause	; only show pause colour when actually paused
    673  3e4e
    674  3e4e		       a6 81		      ldx	Platform
    675  3e50		       bd c1 f6 	      lda	pscol,x
    676  3e53		       85 af		      sta	BGColour	; set main screen background colour.  RED is paused.
    677  3e55
    678  3e55				   .exitPause
    679  3e55
    680  3e55							;----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
    681  3e55
    682  3e55							; has to be done AFTER screen display, because it disables the effect!
    683  3e55		       a5 87		      lda	rnd	; 3	 randomly reposition the Cosmic Ark missile
    684  3e57		       85 62		      sta	HMM0	; 3	 this assumes that HMOVE is called at least once/frame
    685  3e59
    686  3e59							; "Flash" has highest BG colour priority
    687  3e59
    688  3e59		       a6 c5		      ldx	ColourTimer
    689  3e5b		       f0 06		      beq	noFlashBG
    690  3e5d		       c6 c5		      dec	ColourTimer
    691  3e5f		       a9 0e		      lda	#WHITE
    692  3e61		       85 af		      sta	BGColour
    693  3e63				   noFlashBG
    694  3e63
    695  3e63		       a5 c6		      lda	extraLifeTimer
    696  3e65		       f0 02		      beq	alreadyBlack2
    697  3e67		       c6 c6		      dec	extraLifeTimer
    698  3e69				   alreadyBlack2
    699  3e69
    700  3e69							; Handle the player joystick reading. We do it *every frame* so that we can incorporate a two-frame
    701  3e69							; buffer.  This is designed to give a little better responsiveness to the 'quick tap' movement.
    702  3e69
    703  3e69		       a5 95		      lda	BufferedJoystick	; previous frame
    704  3e6b		       85 96		      sta	BufferedJoystick+1	; -> buffered
    705  3e6d
    706  3e6d							; Create a 'standardised' joystick with D4-D7 having bits CLEAR if the appropriate direction is chosen.
    707  3e6d							; P2 is shifted UP, so we don't need to worry in usage elsewhere (it's same format as a P1 joystick)
    708  3e6d
    709  3e6d		       a5 9e		      lda	whichPlayer	; 3
    710  3e6f		       25 ac		      and	jtoggle	; 3
    711  3e71		       aa		      tax		; 2
    712  3e72
    713  3e72		       b5 4c		      lda	INPT4,x	; 4
    714  3e74		       85 97		      sta	BufferedButton	; 3 = 15
    715  3e76
    716  3e76		       ad 80 02 	      lda	SWCHA	; 4
    717  3e79
    718  3e79		       ca		      dex		; 2
    719  3e7a		       30 04		      bmi	notP2	; 2/3= 8/9
    720  3e7c
    721  3e7c		       0a		      asl		; 2
    722  3e7d		       0a		      asl		; 2
    723  3e7e		       0a		      asl		; 2
    724  3e7f		       0a		      asl		; 2 =	8
    725  3e80		       85 95	   notP2      sta	BufferedJoystick	; 3
    726  3e82
    727  3e82
    728  3e82							; "Scoring timer" reset stomp comment
    729  3e82
    730  3e82		       a5 c7		      lda	scoringTimer
    731  3e84		       f0 0a		      beq	timer0now
    732  3e86		       c6 c7		      dec	scoringTimer
    733  3e88		       d0 06		      bne	timer0now
    734  3e8a		       a5 c8		      lda	scoringFlags
    735  3e8c		       29 fc		      and	#<(~DISPLAY_FLAGS)	;	 switches to time display
    736  3e8e		       85 c8		      sta	scoringFlags
    737  3e90				   timer0now
    738  3e90
    739  3e90							; fall through
    740  3e90
    741  3e90							;-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
    742  3e90							; Player animation happens *every* frame so that we get good animation speeds.  Note that
    743  3e90							; the player animation consists of running a small animation 'program', and then actually drawing
    744  3e90							; the player.	The draw is the neat bit, because all it does is update some self-modifying pointers
    745  3e90							; inside the actual draw kernel in the appropriate bank.
    746  3e90
    747  3e90
      0  3e90					      DEFINE_SUBROUTINE	AnimatePlayers	; in GENERIC_BANK_1
      1  3e90		       00 07	   BANK_AnimatePlayers =	_CURRENT_BANK
      2  3e90					      SUBROUTINE
      3  3e90				   AnimatePlayers
    749  3e90
    750  3e90							; Optimised 7/1/2012 -- single page tables
    751  3e90
    752  3e90							; This interesting code performs the animations for the player(s) and sets the
    753  3e90							; pointers INSIDE the row bank for the draw code to point to the correct player
    754  3e90							; shape.  Kind of neat, as it doesn't require any shape copying (=speed!)
    755  3e90
    756  3e90
    757  3e90							; Cycle the player through his animation list.  The animation of a player is a direct
    758  3e90							; pointer to the actual shape used to display the player.  This shape is in turn
    759  3e90							; written to the current bank's self-modifying locations for the draw.  Since
    760  3e90							; we are effectively drawing from this current bank, the same code can be used
    761  3e90							; to 'undraw' the player as required.
    762  3e90
    763  3e90
    764  3e90							; x = player index
    765  3e90							; sets ManAnimation = FRAME to display for player
    766  3e90							; ManAnimation = index of player program into Manimate list
    767  3e90
    768  3e90		       24 80		      bit	gameMode
    769  3e92		       30 2c		      bmi	AnimationOK	; don't animate during pause
    770  3e94
    771  3e94		       c6 a4		      dec	ManDelayCount
    772  3e96		       10 28		      bpl	AnimationOK
    773  3e98
    774  3e98		       a4 a5	   ReloadAnimation ldy	ManAnimation
    775  3e9a		       b9 29 f5    ContinueAnim lda	Manimate,y	; delay count
    776  3e9d		       d0 07		      bne	NewFrameOK
    777  3e9f		       b9 2a f5 	      lda	Manimate+1,y
    778  3ea2		       a8		      tay
    779  3ea3		       4c 9a f6 	      jmp	ContinueAnim
    780  3ea6
    781  3ea6		       10 0d	   NewFrameOK bpl	doDelay
    782  3ea8
    783  3ea8		       c8		      iny		; handle a REFLECT
    784  3ea9		       a5 a8		      lda	ManLastDirection
    785  3eab		       29 f7		      and	#%11110111
    786  3ead		       19 29 f5 	      ora	Manimate,y
    787  3eb0		       85 a8		      sta	ManLastDirection
    788  3eb2
    789  3eb2		       c8		      iny
    790  3eb3		       d0 e5		      bne	ContinueAnim
    791  3eb5
    792  3eb5		       85 a4	   doDelay    sta	ManDelayCount
    793  3eb7
    794  3eb7		       c8		      iny
    795  3eb8		       b9 29 f5 	      lda	Manimate,y
    796  3ebb		       85 a7		      sta	ManAnimationFrameLO
    797  3ebd
    798  3ebd		       c8		      iny
    799  3ebe		       84 a5		      sty	ManAnimation
    800  3ec0
    801  3ec0		       60	   AnimationOK rts
    802  3ec1
    803  3ec1
    804  3ec1
    805  3ec1		       40 40	   pscol      .byte.b	$40, $40
    806  3ec3		       60 60		      .byte.b	$60, $60
    807  3ec5
    808  3ec5							;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
    809  3ec5
------- FILE i2c_v2.2.inc LEVEL 3 PASS 3
      0  3ec5					      include	"i2c_v2.2.inc"
      1  3ec5							;
      2  3ec5							; i2c_v2.2.inc
      3  3ec5							;
      4  3ec5							;
      5  3ec5							; AtariVox EEPROM Driver
      6  3ec5							;
      7  3ec5							; By Alex Herbert, 2004
      8  3ec5							;
      9  3ec5							; Optimisations by Thomas Jentzsch, 2006/2008
     10  3ec5							;
     11  3ec5
     12  3ec5
     13  3ec5							; I/O Constants
     14  3ec5
     15  3ec5		       00 04	   I2C_SDA_MASK equ	$04
     16  3ec5		       00 08	   I2C_SCL_MASK equ	$08
     17  3ec5
     18  3ec5
     19  3ec5							; Signalling Macros
     20  3ec5
     21  3ec5							;  MAC     I2C_SCL_0
     22  3ec5							;    lda     #$00
     23  3ec5							;    sta     SWCHA
     24  3ec5							;  ENDM
     25  3ec5
     26  3ec5							;  MAC     I2C_SCL_1
     27  3ec5							;    lda     #I2C_SCL_MASK
     28  3ec5							;    sta     SWCHA
     29  3ec5							;  ENDM
     30  3ec5
     31  3ec5							;  MAC     I2C_SDA_IN
     32  3ec5							;    lda     #I2C_SCL_MASK
     33  3ec5							;    sta     SWACNT
     34  3ec5							;  ENDM
     35  3ec5
     36  3ec5							;  MAC     I2C_SDA_OUT
     37  3ec5							;    lda     #I2C_SCL_MASK|I2C_SDA_MASK
     38  3ec5							;    sta     SWACNT
     39  3ec5							;  ENDM
     40  3ec5
     41  3ec5
     42  3ec5					      MAC	i2c_start
     43  3ec5							; I2C_SCL_1
     44  3ec5					      lda	#(I2C_SCL_MASK|I2C_SDA_MASK)*2	; 2	     I2C_SCL_MASK
     45  3ec5					      sta	SWCHA	; 4
     46  3ec5							; I2C_SDA_OUT
     47  3ec5					      lsr		; 2	     I2C_SCL_MASK|I2C_SDA_MASK
     48  3ec5					      sta	SWACNT	; 4
     49  3ec5							; total: 12 cycles
     50  3ec5					      ENDM
     51  3ec5
     52  3ec5
     53  3ec5					      MAC	i2c_txbit
     54  3ec5							; I2C_SCL_0
     55  3ec5					      lda	#%0011	; 2
     56  3ec5					      sta	SWCHA	; 4
     57  3ec5							; set bit
     58  3ec5					      adc	#%1000	; 2
     59  3ec5					      sta	SWACNT	; 4	     SDA = !C (a = %1000 / %1100)
     60  3ec5							; I2C_SCL_1
     61  3ec5					      lda	#I2C_SCL_MASK	; 2
     62  3ec5					      sta	SWCHA	; 4
     63  3ec5							; total: 18 cycles
     64  3ec5					      ENDM
     65  3ec5
     66  3ec5
     67  3ec5					      MAC	i2c_txnack
     68  3ec5							; I2C_SCL_0
     69  3ec5					      lda	#I2C_SCL_MASK*2	; 2	     $00
     70  3ec5					      sta	SWCHA	; 4
     71  3ec5							; I2C_SDA_IN
     72  3ec5					      lsr		; 2	     I2C_SCL_MASK
     73  3ec5					      sta	SWACNT	; 4
     74  3ec5							; I2C_SCL_1
     75  3ec5					      nop		; 2	     required for timing!
     76  3ec5					      sta	SWCHA	; 4	     I2C_SCL_MASK
     77  3ec5							; total: 18 cycles
     78  3ec5					      ENDM
     79  3ec5
     80  3ec5
     81  3ec5							; Subroutine Macros
     82  3ec5
     83  3ec5					      MAC	i2c_subs
     84  3ec5
     85  3ec5				   i2c_startread
     86  3ec5							; use V to flag if previous byte needs ACK
     87  3ec5					      ldy	#%10100001	; 2	     eeprom read command
     88  3ec5					      .byte	$2c	; 2
     89  3ec5				   i2c_startwrite
     90  3ec5					      ldy	#%10100000	; 2	     eeprom write command
     91  3ec5					      I2C_START		;12	     start signal (clears V flag)
     92  3ec5					      tya		; 2 = 16
     93  3ec5				   i2c_txbyte
     94  3ec5					      eor	#$ff	; 2	     invert data byte
     95  3ec5					      sec		; 2
     96  3ec5					      rol		; 2 =	6    shift loop bit into a
     97  3ec5				   i2c_txbyteloop
     98  3ec5					      tay		; 2
     99  3ec5					      I2C_TXBIT		;18	     transmit
    100  3ec5					      tya		; 2
    101  3ec5					      asl		; 2	     shift next bit into C
    102  3ec5					      bne	i2c_txbyteloop	; 2= 26/27
    103  3ec5
    104  3ec5							; receive acknowledge bit
    105  3ec5
    106  3ec5					      beq	i2c_rxbit	;43 = 43
    107  3ec5							; i2c_txbyte: 264 cycles
    108  3ec5							;-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
    109  3ec5
    110  3ec5				   i2c_rxbyte
    111  3ec5					      bvc	i2c_rxskipack	; 2	     previous byte needs acknowledge?
    112  3ec5					      jsr	i2c_txack	;24	     transmit acknowledge bit
    113  3ec5
    114  3ec5				   i2c_rxskipack
    115  3ec5					      bit	i2c_rxbyte	; 4	     set V - next byte(s) require acknowledge
    116  3ec5
    117  3ec5					      lda	#1	; 2
    118  3ec5				   i2c_rxbyteloop
    119  3ec5					      tay		; 2 =	2
    120  3ec5				   i2c_rxbit		;	     receive bit in C
    121  3ec5					      I2C_TXNACK		;18 = 18
    122  3ec5
    123  3ec5					      lda	SWCHA	; 4
    124  3ec5					      lsr		; 2
    125  3ec5					      lsr		; 2
    126  3ec5					      lsr		; 2 = 10    C = SDA
    127  3ec5
    128  3ec5					      tya		; 2
    129  3ec5					      rol		; 2	     rotate into Y
    130  3ec5					      bcc	i2c_rxbyteloop	; 2=	6/7
    131  3ec5
    132  3ec5							; received byte in A
    133  3ec5					      rts		; 6 =	6
    134  3ec5							; i2c_rxbit:  40 cycles
    135  3ec5							; i2c_rxbyte: 310/333 cycles
    136  3ec5							;-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
    137  3ec5
    138  3ec5				   i2c_stopread
    139  3ec5					      bvc	i2c_stopwrite	; 2
    140  3ec5					      ldy	#$80	; 2
    141  3ec5					      jsr	i2c_rxbit	;46	     transmit no-acknowledge
    142  3ec5
    143  3ec5				   i2c_stopwrite
    144  3ec5					      jsr	i2c_txack	;30
    145  3ec5
    146  3ec5							; return port to input mode
    147  3ec5					      lda	#0	; 2	     0
    148  3ec5					      sta	SWACNT	; 4
    149  3ec5					      rts		; 6 = 12
    150  3ec5							; i2c_stopread:  45/92
    151  3ec5							; i2c_stopwrite: 42
    152  3ec5							;-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
    153  3ec5
    154  3ec5				   i2c_txack
    155  3ec5							; I2C_SCL_0
    156  3ec5					      lda	#0	; 2	     $00
    157  3ec5					      sta	SWCHA	; 4
    158  3ec5							; I2C_SDA_OUT
    159  3ec5					      lda	#(I2C_SCL_MASK|I2C_SDA_MASK)	; 2	     I2C_SCL_MASK|I2C_SDA_MASK
    160  3ec5					      sta	SWACNT	; 4
    161  3ec5							; I2C_SCL_1
    162  3ec5					      asl		; 2	     I2C_SCL_MASK
    163  3ec5					      sta	SWCHA	; 4
    164  3ec5
    165  3ec5					      rts		; 6
    166  3ec5							; total: 24 cycles
    167  3ec5							;-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
    168  3ec5
    169  3ec5					      ENDM
    170  3ec5
    171  3ec5
    172  3ec5

      7  3ec8		       a0 a0		      ldy	#%10100000
      0  3eca					      I2C_START
      1  3eca

      3  3ecc		       8d 80 02 	      sta	SWCHA
      4  3ecf
      5  3ecf		       4a		      lsr
      6  3ed0		       8d 81 02 	      sta	SWACNT
      7  3ed3

     10  3ed4				   i2c_txbyte

     13  3ed7		       2a		      rol
     14  3ed8				   i2c_txbyteloop
     15  3ed8		       a8		      tay
      0  3ed9					      I2C_TXBIT

      3  3edb		       8d 80 02 	      sta	SWCHA
      4  3ede

      6  3ee0		       8d 81 02 	      sta	SWACNT
      7  3ee3
      8  3ee3		       a9 08		      lda	#I2C_SCL_MASK
      9  3ee5		       8d 80 02 	      sta	SWCHA
     10  3ee8
     17  3ee8		       98		      tya
     18  3ee9		       0a		      asl
     19  3eea		       d0 ec		      bne	i2c_txbyteloop
     20  3eec
     21  3eec
     22  3eec
     23  3eec		       f0 0b		      beq	i2c_rxbit
     24  3eee

     26  3eee

    813  3f30
    814  3f30				   HandleSaveKey SUBROUTINE
    815  3f30
    816  3f30		       06 00	   SAVEKEY_ADR =	$0600	;	     reserved address for Boulder Dash (64 bytes)
    817  3f30
    818  3f30							; SK Memory Map:
    819  3f30							;		 cave	 level
    820  3f30							; $0600-$0602	 A	 1
    821  3f30							; $0603-$0605	 A	 2
    822  3f30							; $0606-$0608	 A	 3
    823  3f30							; $0609-$060b	 A	 4
    824  3f30							; $060c-$060e	 A	 5
    825  3f30							; $060f-$0611	 E	 1
    826  3f30							; $0612-$0614	 E	 2
    827  3f30							; $0615-$0617	 E	 3
    828  3f30							; $0618-$061a	 unused
    829  3f30							; $061b-$061d	 unused
    830  3f30							; $061e-$0620	 I	 1
    831  3f30							; $0621-$0623	 I	 2
    832  3f30							; $0624-$0626	 I	 3
    833  3f30							; $0627-$0629	 unused
    834  3f30							; $062a-$062c	 unused
    835  3f30							; $062d-$062f	 M	 1
    836  3f30							; $0630-$0632	 M	 2
    837  3f30							; $0633-$0635	 M	 3
    838  3f30							; $0636-$063f	 unused
    839  3f30
    840  3f30							;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
      0  3f30					      DEFINE_SUBROUTINE	ReadSaveKey	; = 2371
      1  3f30		       00 07	   BANK_ReadSaveKey =	_CURRENT_BANK
      2  3f30					      SUBROUTINE
      3  3f30				   ReadSaveKey
    842  3f30
    843  3f30							; assume no SaveKey found:
    844  3f30		       a9 ff		      lda	#$ff	; 2	     return $ff if no SaveKey found
    845  3f32		       85 e4		      sta	highScoreSK+2	; 3
    846  3f34
    847  3f34							; setup SaveKey:
    848  3f34		       a5 e5		      lda	startCave	; 3	     load start cave*5 and level
    849  3f36		       a6 b1		      ldx	level	; 3
    850  3f38		       20 71 f7 	      jsr	SetupSaveKey	;6+853
    851  3f3b		       90 52		      bcc	NoSKfound	; 2/3
    852  3f3d
    853  3f3d							;    lda     #$34
    854  3f3d							;    sta     COLUBK
    855  3f3d
    856  3f3d							; start read
    857  3f3d		       20 18 f7 	      jsr	i2c_stopwrite	;6+42	     end of "fake" write
    858  3f40		       20 c5 f6 	      jsr	i2c_startread	;6+284      Start signal and $a1 command byte
    859  3f43
    860  3f43							; read high score:
    861  3f43		       a2 02		      ldx	#3-1	; 2 = 1187
    862  3f45				   .loopRead
    863  3f45		       20 ee f6 	      jsr	i2c_rxbyte	;6+333      read byte from EEPROM
    864  3f48		       c9 ff		      cmp	#$ff	; 2	     EEPROM slot empty?
    865  3f4a		       d0 02		      bne	.skipEmpty	; 2/3	      no, skip clear
    866  3f4c		       a9 00		      lda	#0	; 2	     clear EEPROM slot
    867  3f4e				   .skipEmpty
    868  3f4e		       95 e2		      sta	highScoreSK,x	; 4
    869  3f50		       ca		      dex		; 2
    870  3f51		       10 f2		      bpl	.loopRead	; 2/3= 354
    871  3f53
    872  3f53							; stop read:
    873  3f53		       4c 11 f7 	      jmp	i2c_stopread	;3+92=95    terminate read
    874  3f56
    875  3f56							;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
      0  3f56					      DEFINE_SUBROUTINE	WriteSaveKey	; = 1751
      1  3f56		       00 07	   BANK_WriteSaveKey =	_CURRENT_BANK
      2  3f56					      SUBROUTINE
      3  3f56				   WriteSaveKey
    877  3f56
    878  3f56							; check if new high score:
    879  3f56		       a6 e2		      ldx	highScoreSK	; 3
    880  3f58		       e8		      inx		; 2
    881  3f59		       f0 34		      beq	NoSKfound	; 2/3	     no new high score, abort
    882  3f5b
    883  3f5b							; setup SaveKey:
    884  3f5b		       a5 e5		      lda	startCave	; 3	     load start cave*5 and level
    885  3f5d		       a6 e6		      ldx	startLevel	; 3
    886  3f5f		       20 71 f7 	      jsr	SetupSaveKey	; 6+853
    887  3f62		       90 2b		      bcc	NoSKfound	; 2/3
    888  3f64
    889  3f64							;    lda     #$64
    890  3f64							;    sta     COLUBK
    891  3f64
    892  3f64							; write high score:
    893  3f64		       a2 02		      ldx	#3-1	; 2 = 841
    894  3f66				   .loopWrite
    895  3f66		       b5 e2		      lda	highScoreSK,x	; 4
    896  3f68		       20 d4 f6 	      jsr	i2c_txbyte	;6+264      transmit to EEPROM
    897  3f6b		       ca		      dex		; 2
    898  3f6c		       10 f8		      bpl	.loopWrite	; 2/3= 837
    899  3f6e
    900  3f6e							; stop write:
    901  3f6e		       4c 18 f7 	      jmp	i2c_stopwrite	; 3+42= 45  terminate write and commit to memory
    902  3f71
    903  3f71
    904  3f71							;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
      0  3f71					      DEFINE_SUBROUTINE	SetupSaveKey	; = 853
      1  3f71		       00 07	   BANK_SetupSaveKey =	_CURRENT_BANK
      2  3f71					      SUBROUTINE
      3  3f71				   SetupSaveKey
    906  3f71
    907  3f71							; calculate slot;
    908  3f71							; a = cave (5*n): A=$00; E=$05; I=$0a; M=$0f
    909  3f71							; x = level (0..4)
    910  3f71		       85 e7		      sta	offsetSK	; 3
    911  3f73		       8a		      txa		; 2
    912  3f74		       18		      clc		; 2
    913  3f75		       65 e7		      adc	offsetSK	; 3
    914  3f77		       85 e7		      sta	offsetSK	; 3
    915  3f79		       0a		      asl		; 2	     multiply by 3
    916  3f7a		       65 e7		      adc	offsetSK	; 3
    917  3f7c		       69 00		      adc	#<SAVEKEY_ADR	; 2
    918  3f7e		       aa		      tax		; 2 = 22
    919  3f7f							; detect SaveKey:
    920  3f7f		       20 c8 f6 	      jsr	i2c_startwrite	;6+280
    921  3f82		       d0 0a		      bne	.exitSK	; 2/3
    922  3f84
    923  3f84							; setup address:
    924  3f84		       b8		      clv		; 2
    925  3f85		       a9 06		      lda	#>SAVEKEY_ADR	; 2	     upper byte of address
    926  3f87		       20 d4 f6 	      jsr	i2c_txbyte	;6+264
    927  3f8a		       8a		      txa		; 2	     x = lower byte offset
    928  3f8b		       4c d4 f6 	      jmp	i2c_txbyte	;3+264      returns C==1
    929  3f8e
    930  3f8e				   .exitSK
    931  3f8e		       18		      clc
    932  3f8f				   NoSKfound
    933  3f8f		       60		      rts
    934  3f8f					      ENDIF
    935  3f90
    936  3f90
      0  3f90					      CHECK_BANK_SIZE	"GENERIC_BANK_1 -- full 2K"
      1  3f90		       07 90	   .TEMP      =	* - BANK_START
 GENERIC_BANK_1 -- full 2K (2K) SIZE =  $790 , FREE= $70
      2  3f90					      ECHO	"GENERIC_BANK_1 -- full 2K", "(2K) SIZE = ", .TEMP, ", FREE=", ROM_BANK_SIZE - .TEMP
      3  3f90				  -	      if	( .TEMP ) > ROM_BANK_SIZE
      4  3f90				  -	      ECHO	"BANK OVERFLOW @ ", * - ORIGIN
      5  3f90				  -	      ERR
      6  3f90					      endif

      4  4000				   BANK_START SET	*
      5  4000				   INITBANK   SET	ORIGIN / 2048
      6  4000				   ORIGIN     SET	ORIGIN + 2048
      7  4000				   _CURRENT_BANK SET	INITBANK
      3  4000
      4  4000		       00		      .byte.b	0	; to avoid extra cycle when accessing via BoardLineStartLO-1,y
      5  4001
      0  4001					      DEFINE_SUBROUTINE	BoardLineStartLO
      1  4001		       00 08	   BANK_BoardLineStartLO =	_CURRENT_BANK
      2  4001					      SUBROUTINE
      3  4001				   BoardLineStartLO
      7  4001
      8  4001							; Gives the start address (LO) of each board line
      9  4001
     10  4001				   .BOARD_LOCATION SET	Board
     11  4001					      REPEAT	SIZE_BOARD_Y
     12  4001				  -	      IF	>.BOARD_LOCATION != >(.BOARD_LOCATION + SIZE_BOARD_X-1)
     13  4001				  -.BOARD_LOCATION SET	.BOARD_LOCATION - <.BOARD_LOCATION + 256
     14  4001					      ENDIF
     15  4001		       00		      .byte.b	<.BOARD_LOCATION
     16  4001				   .BOARD_LOCATION SET	.BOARD_LOCATION + SIZE_BOARD_X
     11  4001					      REPEND
     12  4002				  -	      IF	>.BOARD_LOCATION != >(.BOARD_LOCATION + SIZE_BOARD_X-1)
     13  4002				  -.BOARD_LOCATION SET	.BOARD_LOCATION - <.BOARD_LOCATION + 256
     14  4002					      ENDIF

     50  4042				  -.BOARD_LOCATION SET	.BOARD_LOCATION - <.BOARD_LOCATION + 256
     51  4042					      ENDIF

     53  4042				   .BOARD_LOCATION SET	.BOARD_LOCATION + SIZE_BOARD_X
     54  4043					      REPEND

     80  4043				   CopyROMShadowToRAM_F000
     81  4043		       a9 f0		      lda	#>$F000
     82  4045
      0  4045					      DEFINE_SUBROUTINE	CopyROMShadowToRAM	; in INITBANK
      1  4045		       00 08	   BANK_CopyROMShadowToRAM =	_CURRENT_BANK
      2  4045					      SUBROUTINE
      3  4045				   CopyROMShadowToRAM
     84  4045
     85  4045							; Function copies a RAM prototype ROM bank into the destination RAM bank.  Typically
     86  4045							; the variable definitions are in the ROM shadow because this allows auto-initialisation
     87  4045							; of the variable contents from ROM declarations, but still allows access to them as
     88  4045							; variables when the correct RAM bank is switched in.	Code is also, of course, copied
     89  4045							; into the RAM destination so that code is callable whenever the ROM *or* RAM bank is
     90  4045							; switched in.  Further, if multiple copies are made to multiple RAM banks, then the
     91  4045							; code co-lives in all banks and may run even as bankswitching occurs between those
     92  4045							; banks -- by the very code itself.
     93  4045
     94  4045							; Note: Relies on ROM_Bank having being set via CALL mechanism to call this function
     95  4045		       85 c0		      sta	Board_AddressR+1
     96  4047		       86 e0		      stx	O_ROM_Source_Bank	; source bank
     97  4049		       84 c4		      sty	RAM_Bank	; destination bank
     98  404b
     99  404b		       a0 00		      ldy	#0
    100  404d		       84 bf		      sty	Board_AddressR
    101  404f		       84 c1		      sty	Board_AddressW
    102  4051		       a9 14		      lda	#>($1000+RAM_WRITE)
    103  4053		       85 c2		      sta	Board_AddressW+1
    104  4055
    105  4055							; Iterate 4 pages (1K) for complete bank copy
    106  4055
    107  4055		       a9 04		      lda	#4
    108  4057		       85 df		      sta	O_CopyCount
    109  4059
    110  4059		       84 e1	   CopyPage   sty	O_Index
    111  405b		       a5 e0		      lda	O_ROM_Source_Bank
    112  405d		       20 61 f8 	      jsr	GetROMByte	; get byte from ROM shadow bank
    113  4060							;tax
    114  4060		       a4 e1		      ldy	O_Index
    115  4062		       a6 c4		      ldx	RAM_Bank
    116  4064		       20 6f f8 	      jsr	PutBoardCharacter	;6+21(A)	 write byte to RAM bank
    117  4067
    118  4067		       a4 e1		      ldy	O_Index
    119  4069		       c8		      iny
    120  406a		       d0 ed		      bne	CopyPage
    121  406c
    122  406c		       e6 c0		      inc	Board_AddressR+1
    123  406e		       e6 c2		      inc	Board_AddressW+1
    124  4070
    125  4070		       c6 df		      dec	O_CopyCount
    126  4072		       d0 e5		      bne	CopyPage
    127  4074
    128  4074		       a4 c4		      ldy	RAM_Bank	; TODO: remove!?
    129  4076		       60		      rts
    130  4077
    131  4077
    132  4077							;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
      0  4077					      DEFINE_SUBROUTINE	SetPlatformColours	; in INITBANK
      1  4077		       00 08	   BANK_SetPlatformColours =	_CURRENT_BANK
      2  4077					      SUBROUTINE
      3  4077				   SetPlatformColours
    134  4077
    135  4077							; Now modify the hardwired colours so that we're correctly switched for NTSC/PAL
    136  4077							; The platform (0=NTSC, 1=PAL) is set from the right difficulty switch
    137  4077							; Note: This relies on DrawTheScreen starting on page boundary so that the (),y
    138  4077							; addressing will not violate the page-crossing restriction of 3E.
    139  4077
    140  4077							; TODO: adapt for fast vertical scrolling
    141  4077
    142  4077							;		  sty RAM_Bank			  ; we assume we called CopyROMShadowToRAM before
    143  4077
    144  4077		       a9 00		      lda	#<DrawTheScreen	; = 0
    145  4079		       85 c1		      sta	Board_AddressW
    146  407b		       a9 f4		      lda	#>( DrawTheScreen + RAM_WRITE )
    147  407d		       85 c2		      sta	Board_AddressW+1
    148  407f
    149  407f							; first, set the x index (with last one being a RTS ($60))
    150  407f
    151  407f		       a6 c4		      ldx	RAM_Bank
    152  4081		       e0 07		      cpx	#SCREEN_LINES-1	; might become variable when vertical scrolling
    153  4083		       d0 07		      bne	.skipPatch
    154  4085		       a9 60		      lda	#$60	; rts
    155  4087		       a0 41		      ldy	#<SELFMOD_X
    156  4089		       20 6f f8 	      jsr	PutBoardCharacter	;6+21(A)	 set index/rts
    157  408c				   .skipPatch
    158  408c
    159  408c		       a2 02		      ldx	#3-1
    160  408e				   .loopColor
    161  408e		       86 df		      stx	colorIdx
    162  4090							; set PF colors
    163  4090		       b5 bc		      lda	color,x
    164  4092		       bc b7 f0 	      ldy	SelfModColOfsTbl,x
    165  4095							;tax
    166  4095		       a6 c4		      ldx	RAM_Bank
    167  4097		       20 6f f8 	      jsr	PutBoardCharacter	;6+21(A)	 copy PF colour RED/GREEN/BLUE to self-modifying RAM
    168  409a							; set player colors
    169  409a		       a6 df		      ldx	colorIdx
    170  409c		       bd ba f0 	      lda	SelfModePlayerTbl,x
    171  409f		       a4 81		      ldy	Platform
    172  40a1		       c0 02		      cpy	#PAL
    173  40a3		       90 02		      bcc	.platform0
    174  40a5		       69 14		      adc	#LINES_PER_CHAR-1	; C==1!
    175  40a7				   .platform0
    176  40a7		       bc bd f0 	      ldy	SelfModPlayerColOfsTbl,x
    177  40aa							;tax
    178  40aa		       a6 c4		      ldx	RAM_Bank
    179  40ac		       20 6f f8 	      jsr	PutBoardCharacter	;6+21(A)	 copy player colour RED/GREEN/BLUE to self-modifying RAM
    180  40af							; loop
    181  40af		       a6 df		      ldx	colorIdx
    182  40b1		       ca		      dex
    183  40b2		       10 da		      bpl	.loopColor
    184  40b4
    185  40b4		       a4 c4		      ldy	RAM_Bank
    186  40b6		       60		      rts
    187  40b7
    188  40b7				   SelfModColOfsTbl
    189  40b7		       53 86 1c 	      .byte.b	<(SELFMOD_BLUE+1), <(SELFMOD_GREEN+1), <(SELFMOD_RED+1)
    190  40ba				   SelfModePlayerTbl
    191  40ba		       bd b6 af 	      .byte.b	<SpriteColourBLUE, <SpriteColourGREEN, <SpriteColourRED
    192  40bd				   SelfModPlayerColOfsTbl
    193  40bd		       4c 7f 15 	      .byte.b	<(SELFMOD_PLAYERCOL_BLUE+1), <(SELFMOD_PLAYERCOL_GREEN+1), <(SELFMOD_PLAYERCOL_RED+1)
    194  40c0
    195  40c0
    196  40c0				   DrawLineStartLO
    197  40c0
    198  40c0							; Gives the start address of each line in the draw flags buffer
    199  40c0
    200  40c0				   .DRAW_LOCATION SET	DrawFlag
    201  40c0					      REPEAT	SCREEN_LINES
    202  40c0		       50		      .byte.b	<.DRAW_LOCATION
    203  40c0				   .DRAW_LOCATION SET	.DRAW_LOCATION + SCREEN_WIDTH
    201  40c0					      REPEND
    202  40c1		       5a		      .byte.b	<.DRAW_LOCATION
    203  40c1				   .DRAW_LOCATION SET	.DRAW_LOCATION + SCREEN_WIDTH
    201  40c1					      REPEND
    202  40c2		       64		      .byte.b	<.DRAW_LOCATION
    203  40c2				   .DRAW_LOCATION SET	.DRAW_LOCATION + SCREEN_WIDTH
    201  40c2					      REPEND
    202  40c3		       6e		      .byte.b	<.DRAW_LOCATION
    203  40c3				   .DRAW_LOCATION SET	.DRAW_LOCATION + SCREEN_WIDTH
    201  40c3					      REPEND
    202  40c4		       78		      .byte.b	<.DRAW_LOCATION
    203  40c4				   .DRAW_LOCATION SET	.DRAW_LOCATION + SCREEN_WIDTH
    201  40c4					      REPEND
    202  40c5		       82		      .byte.b	<.DRAW_LOCATION
    203  40c5				   .DRAW_LOCATION SET	.DRAW_LOCATION + SCREEN_WIDTH
    201  40c5					      REPEND
    202  40c6		       8c		      .byte.b	<.DRAW_LOCATION
    203  40c6				   .DRAW_LOCATION SET	.DRAW_LOCATION + SCREEN_WIDTH
    201  40c6					      REPEND
    202  40c7		       96		      .byte.b	<.DRAW_LOCATION
    203  40c7				   .DRAW_LOCATION SET	.DRAW_LOCATION + SCREEN_WIDTH
    204  40c8					      REPEND
    205  40c8

    208  40c8
      0  40c8					      DEFINE_SUBROUTINE	GetBoardAddressRW	; in INITBANK
      1  40c8		       00 08	   BANK_GetBoardAddressRW =	_CURRENT_BANK
      2  40c8					      SUBROUTINE
      3  40c8				   GetBoardAddressRW
    210  40c8							; Must share same bank as BoardLineStart tables
    211  40c8
    212  40c8		       b9 01 f0 	      lda	BoardLineStartLO,y	; 4
    213  40cb		       85 bf		      sta	Board_AddressR	; 3
    214  40cd		       85 c1		      sta	Board_AddressW	; 3
    215  40cf		       b9 17 f0 	      lda	BoardLineStartHiR,y	; 4
    216  40d2		       85 c0		      sta	Board_AddressR+1	; 3	     READ address
    217  40d4		       09 04		      ora	#>RAM_WRITE	; 2
    218  40d6		       85 c2		      sta	Board_AddressW+1	; 3	     WRITE address
    219  40d8				  -	      IF	MULTI_BANK_BOARD = YES
    220  40d8				  -	      ldx	BoardBank,y	; 4 = 26    switch this on return
    221  40d8					      ELSE
    222  40d8		       a2 0d		      ldx	#BANK_BOARD	; 2
    223  40da					      ENDIF
    224  40da		       60		      rts		; 6 = 32[-2]
    225  40db

    481  417d							;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
    482  417d
    483  417d							; IF the creature runs out of time to do stuff, then rts HOWEVER the creature must eventually do something
    484  417d							;  as it will be continually called in available time-slices until it does. This can lockup the system.
    485  417d
    486  417d							; if the creature is done, and is alive next cycle, then jump ReInsertObject
    487  417d
    488  417d							; if the creature dies then jump NextObject
    489  417d

    500  4196
    501  4196							; Thomas, the auto-calculation of these was causing DASM to get confused and abort assembling.
    502  4196							; I don't particularly know why; probably because of the cave variable-size array and the values
    503  4196							; changing from pass to pass. I've put in the hardwired values and it seems to be OK now.
    504  4196
    505  4196		       00 00	   MANMODE_STARTUP =	0
    506  4196		       00 01	   MANMODE_NORMAL =	1
    507  4196		       00 02	   MANMODE_DEAD =	2
    508  4196		       00 03	   MANMODE_WAITING =	3

      3  4196				   ManProcess

    520  419a

    522  419a							; ManMode tells the player what it is currently doing.  State machine.
    523  419a
    524  419a		       ad 82 02 	      lda	SWCHB
    525  419d		       29 03		      and	#3
    526  419f		       d0 03		      bne	.skipReset	; BOTH select/reset = restart
    527  41a1
    528  41a1							;		  lsr SWCHB
    529  41a1							;		  bcs .skipReset
    530  41a1

    533  41a1				  -	      sta	ManMode
    534  41a1					      ELSE
    535  41a1		       4c 69 fb 	      jmp	Restart	; RESET = end game, jump to title screen
    536  41a4					      ENDIF

    548  41ad		       b9 c9 f1 	      lda	ManActionHI,y
    549  41b0		       85 e0		      sta	actionVector+1
    550  41b2		       6c df 00 	      jmp	(actionVector)
    551  41b5
    552  41b5				   ManActionTimer
    553  41b5		       00		      .byte.b	0	;<manStartup		 ; 0		 no timer
    554  41b6		       01		      .byte.b	1	;<normalMan		 ; 1		 timer
    555  41b7		       01		      .byte.b	1	;<deadMan		 ; 2		 timer
    556  41b8		       01		      .byte.b	1	;<waitingMan		 ; 3		 timer
    557  41b9		       01		      .byte.b	1	;<waitingManPress	 ; 4		 timer
    558  41ba		       00		      .byte.b	0	;<waitingManNoTim	 ; 5		 no timer
    559  41bb		       00		      .byte.b	0	;<waitingManPressNoTim  ; 6		 no timer
    560  41bc		       00		      .byte.b	0	;<nextLevelMan 	 ; 7		 no timer
    561  41bd		       02		      .byte.b	2	;<BonusCountdownStart	 ; 8		 fast timer
    562  41be		       02		      .byte.b	2	;<BonusCountdownRun	 ; 9		 fast timer
    563  41bf				   ManActionLO
    564  41bf		       58		      .byte.b	<manStartup	; 0		 no timer
    565  41c0		       fa		      .byte.b	<normalMan	; 1		 timer
    566  41c1		       23		      .byte.b	<deadMan	; 2		 timer
    567  41c2		       9e		      .byte.b	<waitingMan	; 3		 timer
    568  41c3		       c1		      .byte.b	<waitingManPress	; 4		 timer
    569  41c4		       9e		      .byte.b	<waitingMan	; 5		 no timer
    570  41c5		       c1		      .byte.b	<waitingManPress	; 6		 no timer
    571  41c6		       2e		      .byte.b	<nextLevelMan	; 7		 no timer
    572  41c7		       31		      .byte.b	<BonusCountdownStart	; 8		 fast timer
    573  41c8		       4e		      .byte.b	<BonusCountdownRun	; 9		 fast timer
    574  41c9
    575  41c9				   ManActionHI
    576  41c9		       f2		      .byte.b	>manStartup	; no timer
    577  41ca		       f2		      .byte.b	>normalMan	; timer
    578  41cb		       f3		      .byte.b	>deadMan	; timer
    579  41cc		       f2		      .byte.b	>waitingMan	; timer
    580  41cd		       f2		      .byte.b	>waitingManPress	; timer
    581  41ce		       f2		      .byte.b	>waitingMan	; no timer
    582  41cf		       f2		      .byte.b	>waitingManPress	; no timer
    583  41d0		       fd		      .byte.b	>nextLevelMan	; no timer
    584  41d1		       f3		      .byte.b	>BonusCountdownStart	; fast timer
    585  41d2		       f3		      .byte.b	>BonusCountdownRun	; fast timer
    586  41d3
    587  41d3							;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
      0  41d3					      DEFINE_SUBROUTINE	UpdateTimer
      1  41d3		       00 08	   BANK_UpdateTimer =	_CURRENT_BANK
      2  41d3					      SUBROUTINE
      3  41d3				   UpdateTimer
    589  41d3
    590  41d3		       a2 03		      ldx	#3
    591  41d5		       a5 a3		      lda	ManMode
    592  41d7		       c9 09		      cmp	#MANMODE_BONUS_RUN
    593  41d9		       f0 20		      beq	.setLoops
    594  41db
    595  41db		       a2 04		      ldx	#NUM_LEVELS-1	; intermissions run at full speed
    596  41dd		       24 b2		      bit	caveDisplay
    597  41df		       30 02		      bmi	.intermission2
    598  41e1		       a6 b1		      ldx	level
    599  41e3				   .intermission2
    600  41e3		       bd 53 f2 	      lda	TimeFracTbl,x
    601  41e6		       24 aa		      bit	LookingAround
    602  41e8		       10 02		      bpl	notSlowTime
    603  41ea		       a9 00		      lda	#0	; new behaviour: time does not count down when looking around
    604  41ec							;lsr				  ; go half-speed time countdown when looking around
    605  41ec				   notSlowTime
    606  41ec		       65 bb		      adc	caveTimeFrac
    607  41ee		       85 bb		      sta	caveTimeFrac
    608  41f0		       90 56		      bcc	.forceTimeDraw
    609  41f2
    610  41f2							; count down magic wall time in sync with cave time:
    611  41f2		       a6 9d		      ldx	MagicAmoebaFlag
    612  41f4		       e8		      inx		; $FF = dormant?
    613  41f5		       f0 02		      beq	.notActive
    614  41f7		       c6 9d		      dec	MagicAmoebaFlag
    615  41f9				   .notActive
    616  41f9		       a2 01		      ldx	#1
    617  41fb				   .setLoops
    618  41fb		       86 e0		      stx	timerLoops
    619  41fd		       d0 08		      bne	.notScoring
    620  41ff				   .loopTimer
    621  41ff		       a5 b1		      lda	level	; each second left adds 'level' to score
    622  4201		       18		      clc
    623  4202		       69 01		      adc	#1
    624  4204		       20 22 fd 	      jsr	ScoreAdd
    625  4207				   .notScoring
    626  4207		       f8		      sed
    627  4208		       38		      sec
    628  4209		       a5 b9		      lda	caveTime
    629  420b		       e9 01		      sbc	#1
    630  420d		       85 b9		      sta	caveTime
    631  420f		       d8		      cld
    632  4210		       b0 02		      bcs	.skipHi2a
    633  4212		       c6 ba		      dec	caveTimeHi
    634  4214				   .skipHi2a
    635  4214							; check for running out of time sound:
    636  4214		       a5 ba		      lda	caveTimeHi
    637  4216		       d0 35		      bne	.timeAbove9
    638  4218		       a9 09		      lda	#$09
    639  421a		       38		      sec
    640  421b		       e5 b9		      sbc	caveTime
    641  421d		       90 2e		      bcc	.timeAbove9
    642  421f							; this assumes that SND_MASK_HI = %11110000
    643  421f							;  and the time entries are ordered 9 to 0!
    644  421f		       0a		      asl
    645  4220		       0a		      asl
    646  4221		       0a		      asl
    647  4222		       0a		      asl
    648  4223		       69 60		      adc	#SOUND_TIME_9
    649  4225		       85 df		      sta	tmpSound
    650  4227		       a5 db		      lda	newSounds
    651  4229		       29 0f		      and	#<(~SND_MASK_HI)
    652  422b		       05 df		      ora	tmpSound
    653  422d		       85 db		      sta	newSounds
    654  422f				   .skipTimeSound
    655  422f		       a6 b9		      ldx	caveTime
    656  4231		       d0 15		      bne	.timeNotZero
    657  4233		       86 59		      stx	AUDV0	; stop bonus sound
    658  4235		       86 d5		      stx	soundIdxLst
    659  4237				   .contChannel1
    660  4237		       a2 07		      ldx	#MANMODE_NEXTLEVEL	; time bonus
    661  4239		       a5 a3		      lda	ManMode
    662  423b		       c9 09		      cmp	#MANMODE_BONUS_RUN
    663  423d		       f0 07		      beq	.nextLevel
    664  423f		       a2 06		      ldx	#MANMODE_WAITING_NT2	; time over
    665  4241		       c9 04		      cmp	#MANMODE_WAITING2	; Man already dead?
    666  4243		       f0 01		      beq	.nextLevel
    667  4245		       ca		      dex		; == MANMODE_WAITING_NT
    668  4246				   .nextLevel
    669  4246		       86 a3		      stx	ManMode	; -> man dies, but no explosion
    670  4248				   .timeNotZero
    671  4248				   .forceTimeDraw
    672  4248		       a9 09		      lda	#BANK_SCORING
    673  424a		       4c 4f f8 	      jmp	DrawTimeFromROM	; Z-flag == 0!
    674  424d
    675  424d				   .timeAbove9
    676  424d		       c6 e0		      dec	timerLoops
    677  424f		       d0 ae		      bne	.loopTimer
    678  4251		       f0 f5		      beq	.forceTimeDraw
    679  4253
    680  4253				   TimeFracTbl
    681  4253		       1f		      .byte.b	31	; level 1, NTSC/PAL
    682  4254		       1b		      .byte.b	27	; level 2, NTSC/PAL
    683  4255		       18		      .byte.b	24	; level 3, NTSC/PAL
    684  4256		       17		      .byte.b	23	; level 4, NTSC/PAL
    685  4257		       16		      .byte.b	22	; level 5, NTSC/PAL
    686  4258							; calculate: level 5 throttle * level 5 time / level x throttle
    687  4258
    688  4258
    689  4258							;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
      0  4258					      DEFINE_SUBROUTINE	manStartup
      1  4258		       00 08	   BANK_manStartup =	_CURRENT_BANK
      2  4258					      SUBROUTINE
      3  4258				   manStartup
    691  4258
    692  4258		       a5 9f		      lda	ManX
    693  425a		       85 91		      sta	POS_X_NEW	;NewX
    694  425c		       85 8f		      sta	POS_X
    695  425e		       a5 a0		      lda	ManY
    696  4260		       85 92		      sta	POS_Y_NEW	;NewY
    697  4262		       85 90		      sta	POS_Y
    698  4264
    699  4264		       e6 94		      inc	POS_VAR
    700  4266		       a6 94		      ldx	POS_VAR	; animation index
    701  4268		       bd 8a f2 	      lda	.RockfordStartup-1,x
    702  426b		       30 1b		      bmi	CreateRockford
    703  426d		       85 93		      sta	POS_Type
    704  426f
    705  426f							; check for start of "crack" sound:
    706  426f		       c9 16		      cmp	#CHARACTER_EXPLOSION3	; first explosion frame?
    707  4271		       d0 0e		      bne	.skipCrack1
      0  4273					      START_SOUND	SOUND_CRACK	;  yes, start "crack" sound
      1  4273					      SUBROUTINE
      2  4273		       a5 db		      lda	newSounds
      3  4275				  -	      IF	SOUND_CRACK < 16
      4  4275				  -	      and	#SND_MASK_LO
      5  4275				  -	      cmp	#SOUND_MOVE_SOIL+1
      6  4275				  -	      bcs	.skipNew
      7  4275					      ELSE
      8  4275		       29 f0		      and	#SND_MASK_HI
      9  4277		       c9 30		      cmp	#(SOUND_MOVE_SOIL+1)<<4
     10  4279		       b0 06		      bcs	.skipNew
     11  427b
     12  427b					      ENDIF
     13  427b		       45 db		      eor	newSounds
     14  427d		       09 50		      ora	#SOUND_CRACK
     15  427f		       85 db		      sta	newSounds
     16  4281				   .skipNew
     17  4281					      SUBROUTINE
    709  4281				   .skipCrack1
    710  4281		       a9 ff		      lda	#$FF
    711  4283		       85 a4		      sta	ManDelayCount	; anything, just non-0
    712  4285
    713  4285		       4c 93 f8 	      jmp	PutBoardCharacterFromRAM	;70 --> switches this bank out but who cares!
    714  4288
    715  4288				   CreateRockford

    717  428a				   RTS_CF

    721  428b							;    .byte CHARACTER_NOGO

    748  42a0

    750  42a2		       85 aa		      sta	LookingAround

    758  42ac
    759  42ac							; Man loses a life and re-starts level if lives available
    760  42ac							; Special-case: Bonus levels go to next level.
    761  42ac
    762  42ac		       a5 b2		      lda	caveDisplay
    763  42ae		       30 0d		      bmi	intermission	; don't lose a life on intermission screens
    764  42b0					      IF	NUM_LIVES != -1
    765  42b0		       c6 ab		      dec	MenCurrent	; works for P1P2 format
    766  42b2							; display lives after a live is lost
    767  42b2		       a5 c8		      lda	scoringFlags	;
    768  42b4		       29 fc		      and	#~DISPLAY_FLAGS
    769  42b6		       09 02		      ora	#DISPLAY_LIVES
    770  42b8		       85 c8		      sta	scoringFlags	;
    771  42ba					      ENDIF
    772  42ba		       20 8a fd 	      jsr	goGeneralScoringSetups	; update the life display. Roundabout way of doing it.
    773  42bd				   intermission
    774  42bd
    775  42bd		       a9 78		      lda	#120	; something long.  anything.
    776  42bf		       85 c7		      sta	scoringTimer	; first time through we wait on the current display
    777  42c1
    778  42c1				   waitingManPress
    779  42c1
    780  42c1							; Cycle the score display, player display, level display based on timing
    781  42c1							; see "Scoring timer" reset stomp comment in bank_generic.
    782  42c1
    783  42c1		       a5 c7		      lda	scoringTimer
    784  42c3		       c9 0a		      cmp	#10	; non-zero so we don't get stomped on by the scoring reset in
    785  42c5		       b0 19		      bcs	stillKicking
    786  42c7		       a9 5a		      lda	#90	; something long.  anything.
    787  42c9		       85 c7		      sta	scoringTimer
    788  42cb
    789  42cb		       a5 ab		      lda	MenCurrent
    790  42cd		       29 0f		      and	#$0f
    791  42cf		       c9 01		      cmp	#$01
    792  42d1		       a6 c8		      ldx	scoringFlags
    793  42d3		       e8		      inx
    794  42d4		       8a		      txa
    795  42d5							; if game over for current player, display diamonds/time, score, player/lives/cave and high score
    796  42d5		       29 f3		      and	#$f3
    797  42d7		       90 02		      bcc	gameOver
    798  42d9							; else display diamonds/time and score only
    799  42d9		       29 f1		      and	#$f1
    800  42db		       85 c8	   gameOver   sta	scoringFlags	;
    801  42dd
    802  42dd		       20 8a fd 	      jsr	goGeneralScoringSetups	; update the score display.
    803  42e0
    804  42e0				   stillKicking
    805  42e0
    806  42e0		       a5 97		      lda	BufferedButton	; button pressed?
    807  42e2		       30 15		      bmi	noChange
    808  42e4
      0  42e4					      STOP_CHANNEL	1	; stop all long running sounds
      1  42e4

      4  42e8		       85 5a		      sta	AUDV0+1
    810  42ea

    838  4301		       49 ff		      eor	#$FF
    839  4303		       29 03		      and	#3

    841  4307							;		  lsr

      0  4331					      DEFINE_SUBROUTINE	BonusCountdownStart

    899  4333
      0  4333					      START_SOUND	SOUND_BONUS_POINTS	; one-off trigger of bonus countdown sound
      1  4333					      SUBROUTINE
      2  4333		       a5 db		      lda	newSounds

      4  4335		       29 0f		      and	#SND_MASK_LO

      7  433b				  -	      ELSE
      8  433b				  -	      and	#SND_MASK_HI
      9  433b				  -	      cmp	#(SOUND_MOVE_SOIL+1)<<4
     10  433b				  -	      bcs	.skipNew
     11  433b				  -
     12  433b					      ENDIF

      0  434f					      DEFINE_SUBROUTINE	LookAround	; in INITBANK

    942  4352		       4a		      lsr

    944  4354		       4a		      lsr
    945  4355		       a8		      tay
    946  4356

    950  435a		       65 9b		      adc	BoardScrollX

    953  4360		       85 9b		      sta	BoardScrollX

    970  436f							; Calling code uses 'POS_X_NEW' and 'POS_Y_NEW' as new player position, so these must be set
    971  436f							; before exiting via (for example) look-around option :)
    972  436f
    973  436f		       a5 9f		      lda	ManX
    974  4371		       85 91		      sta	POS_X_NEW
    975  4373		       a5 a0		      lda	ManY
    976  4375		       85 92		      sta	POS_Y_NEW
    977  4377
    978  4377
    979  4377							;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
    980  4377							; Look around is triggered by holding down the fire button for a while, without any other
    981  4377							; joystick directions chosen. The variable LookingAround has a negative value ($FF) when looking
    982  4377							; is active. Otherwise, it is counting down to the time where it will trigger.
    983  4377
    984  4377		       00 00	   LOOK_DELAY =	0
    985  4377
    986  4377		       a2 00		      ldx	#LOOK_DELAY
    987  4379		       a5 97		      lda	BufferedButton
    988  437b		       30 0d		      bmi	noLook	; button?
    989  437d		       a5 aa		      lda	LookingAround
    990  437f		       30 ce		      bmi	LookAround	; already looking
    991  4381		       a5 95		      lda	BufferedJoystick
    992  4383		       c9 f0		      cmp	#$F0
    993  4385		       90 03		      bcc	noLook	; must have no directions chosen
    994  4387		       a6 aa		      ldx	LookingAround
    995  4389		       ca		      dex
    996  438a		       86 aa	   noLook     stx	LookingAround
    997  438c
    998  438c							;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
    999  438c

   1290  4467

   1292  4467				  -	      ECHO	"ERROR: Missing entry in MoveVecLO table!"
   1293  4467				  -	      EXIT
   1294  4467					      ENDIF

 INITBANK (2K) SIZE =  $482 , FREE= $37e
      2  4482					      ECHO	"INITBANK", "(2K) SIZE = ", .TEMP, ", FREE=", ROM_BANK_SIZE - .TEMP
      3  4482				  -	      if	( .TEMP ) > ROM_BANK_SIZE

      5  4482				  -	      ERR

------- FILE BANK_FIXED.asm
     16  782a
     17  782a							;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
     18  782a
      0  782a					      DEFINE_SUBROUTINE	GetSurroundingChars	;=156[-28](C)
      1  782a		       00 0f	   BANK_GetSurroundingChars =	_CURRENT_BANK
      2  782a					      SUBROUTINE
      3  782a				   GetSurroundingChars
     20  782a							; TJ: used by:
     21  782a							; - BANK_INITBANK.asm
     22  782a
     23  782a							; Retrieve the surrounding characters from the board around a given position.
     24  782a							; These are placed into the Surround array with the indexes as shown...
     25  782a
     26  782a							; +------+------+------+
     27  782a							; |*	  | a(0) |	|   *= where Temp_board_address1 points
     28  782a							; +------+------+------+
     29  782a							; | d(3) | X(4) | b(1) |
     30  782a							; +------+------+------+
     31  782a							; |	  | c(2) |	|
     32  782a							; +------+------+------+
     33  782a
     34  782a							; X = ( POS_X,POS_Y )
     35  782a
     36  782a		       a9 08		      lda	#BANK_GetBoardAddress4	;
     37  782c		       85 3f		      sta	SET_BANK	;
     38  782e		       20 e8 f0 	      jsr	GetBoardAddress4	;11+72[-16](C)
     39  7831
     40  7831		       85 3e		      sta	SET_BANK_RAM	;3
     41  7833		       b3 df		      lax	(Temp_Board_Address1),y	;5
     42  7835		       85 82		      sta	Surround	;3
     43  7837
     44  7837				  -	      IF	MULTI_BANK_BOARD = YES
     45  7837				  -	      lda	Temp_Bank3	;3
     46  7837				  -	      sta	SET_BANK_RAM	;3
     47  7837					      ENDIF
     48  7837		       b1 e3		      lda	(Temp_Board_Address3),y	;5
     49  7839		       85 84		      sta	Surround+2	;3
     50  783b
     51  783b				  -	      IF	MULTI_BANK_BOARD = YES
     52  783b				  -	      lda	Temp_Bank2	;3
     53  783b				  -	      sta	SET_BANK_RAM	;3
     54  783b					      ENDIF
     55  783b		       b1 e1		      lda	(Temp_Board_Address2),y	;5
     56  783d		       85 86		      sta	Surround+4	;3
     57  783f
     58  783f		       88		      dey		;2
     59  7840		       b1 e1		      lda	(Temp_Board_Address2),y	;5
     60  7842		       85 85		      sta	Surround+3	;3
     61  7844
     62  7844		       c8		      iny		;2
     63  7845		       c8		      iny		;2
     64  7846		       b1 e1		      lda	(Temp_Board_Address2),y	;5
     65  7848		       85 83		      sta	Surround+1	;3
     66  784a
     67  784a		       a5 c3		      lda	ROM_Bank	;3
     68  784c		       85 3f		      sta	SET_BANK	;3
     69  784e
     70  784e							; returns: X = Surround
     71  784e		       60		      rts		;6 = 156[-12]
     72  784f
     73  784f							;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
     74  784f
      0  784f					      DEFINE_SUBROUTINE	DrawTimeFromROM
      1  784f		       00 0f	   BANK_DrawTimeFromROM =	_CURRENT_BANK
      2  784f					      SUBROUTINE
      3  784f				   DrawTimeFromROM
     76  784f							; TJ: used by:
     77  784f							; - BANK_INITBANK.asm
     78  784f
     79  784f		       85 3e		      sta	SET_BANK_RAM
     80  7851		       20 17 f3 	      jsr	DrawTime
     81  7854		       85 3f		      sta	SET_BANK
     82  7856		       60		      rts
     83  7857

     85  7857
      0  7857					      DEFINE_SUBROUTINE	InsertBlankStack2	;=51(A)
      1  7857		       00 0f	   BANK_InsertBlankStack2 =	_CURRENT_BANK
      2  7857					      SUBROUTINE
      3  7857				   InsertBlankStack2
     87  7857							; TJ: used by:
     88  7857							; - BANK_INITBANK.asm
     89  7857
     90  7857		       85 3e		      sta	SET_BANK_RAM	; 3
     91  7859		       20 f0 f1 	      jsr	InsertBlankStack	; 6+30(A)
     92  785c		       a5 c3		      lda	ROM_Bank	; 3
     93  785e		       85 3f		      sta	SET_BANK	; 3
     94  7860		       60		      rts		; 6
     95  7861
     96  7861							;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
     97  7861
     98  7861
      0  7861					      DEFINE_SUBROUTINE	GetROMByte	;=23(A)
      1  7861		       00 0f	   BANK_GetROMByte =	_CURRENT_BANK
      2  7861					      SUBROUTINE
      3  7861				   GetROMByte
    100  7861							; TJ: used by:
    101  7861							; - BANK_INITBANK.asm
    102  7861							; - DecodeCave.asm
    103  7861
    104  7861							; a = ROM bank to retrieve (NOTE: status negative flag important!!!!!!!)
    105  7861							; y = page index
    106  7861							; ROM_Bank = bank to return to
    107  7861							; (Board_AddressR) = page
    108  7861							; out a = byte from (Board_AddressR)
    109  7861
    110  7861		       85 3f		      sta	SET_BANK	;3
    111  7863		       4c 68 f8 	      jmp	GetBoardCharacter2	;3+17(A)	 unconditional
    112  7866
    113  7866							;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
    114  7866
      0  7866					      DEFINE_SUBROUTINE	GetBoardCharacter	;=20(A)
      1  7866		       00 0f	   BANK_GetBoardCharacter =	_CURRENT_BANK
      2  7866					      SUBROUTINE
      3  7866				   GetBoardCharacter
    116  7866							; TJ: used by:
    117  7866							; - BANK_INITBANK.asm
    118  7866
    119  7866							; call from ROM bank
    120  7866							; switches back to ROM_Bank on exit
    121  7866
    122  7866							; pass A = bank containing character
    123  7866							; Y = x character position
    124  7866							; (Board_AddressR) points to character position
    125  7866							; returns character from board
    126  7866
    127  7866
    128  7866		       85 3e		      sta	SET_BANK_RAM	;3   switch to bank to read
    129  7868
    130  7868				   GetBoardCharacter2		;=17(A)
    131  7868
    132  7868		       b3 bf		      lax	(Board_AddressR),y	;5
    133  786a		       a4 c3		      ldy	ROM_Bank	;3
    134  786c		       84 3f		      sty	SET_BANK	;3   switch back caller's bank
    135  786e		       60		      rts		;6   and go back
    136  786f
    137  786f							;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
    138  786f
      0  786f					      DEFINE_SUBROUTINE	PutBoardCharacter	;=21(A)
      1  786f		       00 0f	   BANK_PutBoardCharacter =	_CURRENT_BANK
      2  786f					      SUBROUTINE
      3  786f				   PutBoardCharacter
    140  786f							; TJ: used by:
    141  786f							; - BANK_INITBANK.asm
    142  786f		       86 3e		      stx	SET_BANK_RAM	; 3
    143  7871
    144  7871				   PutBoardCharacterSB		; =18
    145  7871		       91 c1		      sta	(Board_AddressW),y	; 6
    146  7873		       a5 c3		      lda	ROM_Bank	; 3
    147  7875		       85 3f		      sta	SET_BANK	; 3
    148  7877		       60		      rts		; 6 = 21
    149  7878
    150  7878							;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
    151  7878

      0  7893					      DEFINE_SUBROUTINE	PutBoardCharacterFromRAM	;=71[-2]

      2  7893					      SUBROUTINE
      3  7893				   PutBoardCharacterFromRAM
    189  7893							; TJ: used by:
    190  7893							; - BANK_INITBANK.asm
    191  7893							; - DecodeCave.asm
    192  7893
    193  7893							; POS_Y  = row
    194  7893							; POS_Type = character to write
    195  7893							; POS_X     = column
    196  7893							; RAM_Bank = caller's bank
    197  7893
    198  7893		       a4 90		      ldy	POS_Y	;3
    199  7895
    200  7895		       a9 08		      lda	#BANK_GetBoardAddressW	;
    201  7897		       85 3f		      sta	SET_BANK	;
    202  7899		       20 0d f1 	      jsr	GetBoardAddressW	;11+24[-2](A)
    203  789c
    204  789c		       86 3e		      stx	SET_BANK_RAM	;3
    205  789e
    206  789e		       a4 8f		      ldy	POS_X	;3
    207  78a0		       a5 93		      lda	POS_Type	;3
    208  78a2		       91 c1		      sta	(Board_AddressW),y	;6
    209  78a4		       a4 c4		      ldy	RAM_Bank	;3
    210  78a6		       84 3e		      sty	SET_BANK_RAM	;3 return to RAM caller
    211  78a8		       60		      rts		;6
    212  78a9

    214  78a9							;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
    215  78a9
    216  78a9							;  IF TJ_MODE
    217  78a9							;; experimental code
    218  78a9							;    DEFINE_SUBROUTINE GetRAMByteFromRAM ; = 19
    219  78a9							;
    220  78a9							;		  sty SET_BANK_RAM		      ; 3
    221  78a9							;		  ldy #0			      ; 2
    222  78a9							;		  lda (addressR),y		      ; 5

    224  78a9							;		  rts				      ; 6

    231  78a9							;		  ldy #0			      ; 2
    232  78a9							;		  sta (addressW),y		      ; 6
    233  78a9							;		  stx SET_BANK_RAM		      ; 3     return to RAM caller
    234  78a9							;		  rts				      ; 6
