    238  78a9
    239  78a9
    240  78a9							;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
    241  78a9
    242  78a9
      0  78a9					      DEFINE_SUBROUTINE	ProcessObjStack	; 15 minimum segtime abort
      1  78a9		       00 0f	   BANK_ProcessObjStack =	_CURRENT_BANK
      2  78a9					      SUBROUTINE
      3  78a9				   ProcessObjStack
    244  78a9							; TJ: used by:
    245  78a9							; - BANK_FIXED.asm
    246  78a9
    247  78a9		       ad 84 02 	      lda	INTIM	;4
    248  78ac		       c9 04		      cmp	#MINIMUM_SEGTIME	;2
    249  78ae		       90 55		      bcc	EarlyAbort	;2/3= 8
      0  78b0					      STRESS_TIME	MINIMUM_SEGTIME
      1  78b0				  -	      IF	TEST_MINIMUM_SEGTIME = 1
      2  78b0				  -
      3  78b0				  -
      4  78b0				  -
      5  78b0				  -
      6  78b0				  -
      7  78b0				  -	      echo	"***** WARNING! STRESS_TIME enabled @", ., "! *****"
      8  78b0				  -	      bne	. - 7
      9  78b0					      ENDIF
    251  78b0
    252  78b0		       a5 8a		      lda	ObjStackNum	;3
    253  78b2		       49 01		      eor	#1	;2
    254  78b4		       aa		      tax		;2
    255  78b5
    256  78b5		       a5 dd		      lda	ObjIterator	;3
    257  78b7		       d5 8b		      cmp	ObjStackPtr,x	;5
    258  78b9		       b0 2e		      bcs	doBlanks	;2/3		check for blanks
    259  78bb
    260  78bb							; Process an object...
    261  78bb							; Actual object code (the handlers) starts 82 cycles after previous segtime check!
    262  78bb
    263  78bb		       bc 3b fa 	      ldy	BankObjStack,x	;4
    264  78be		       84 3e		      sty	SET_BANK_RAM	;3
    265  78c0
    266  78c0		       aa		      tax		;2
    267  78c1		       bc 80 11 	      ldy	SortedObjPtr,x	;4		 indirect object pointer list (sorted)
    268  78c4
    269  78c4		       b9 00 10 	      lda	ObjStackX,y	;4
    270  78c7		       85 8f		      sta	POS_X	;3
    271  78c9		       b9 80 10 	      lda	ObjStackY,y	;4
    272  78cc		       85 90		      sta	POS_Y	;3
    273  78ce		       b9 00 11 	      lda	ObjStackVar,y	;4
    274  78d1		       85 94		      sta	POS_VAR	;3
    275  78d3		       be 00 12 	      ldx	ObjStackType,y	;4
    276  78d6		       86 93		      stx	POS_Type	;3
    277  78d8
    278  78d8		       a9 08		      lda	#BANK_VectorProcess	;2
    279  78da		       85 3f		      sta	SET_BANK	;3
    280  78dc
    281  78dc		       bd 3f f4 	      lda	OSPointerHI,x	;4
    282  78df		       85 e0		      sta	POS_Vector+1	;3
    283  78e1		       bd 32 f4 	      lda	OSPointerLO,x	;4
    284  78e4		       85 df		      sta	POS_Vector	;3
    285  78e6
    286  78e6		       6c df 00 	      jmp	(POS_Vector)	;5 = 82	 vector to processor for particular object type
    287  78e9
    288  78e9
    289  78e9							;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
    290  78e9							; Now process the blank stack.  This stack holds all the recently blanked squares
    291  78e9							; and determines (and moves) BOXs or diamonds into these squares.  The space vacated
    292  78e9							; by these objects are added again to the blank stack.
    293  78e9
    294  78e9		       e6 8e	   doBlanks   inc	ScreenDrawPhase
    295  78eb		       a4 8d		      ldy	BlankStackPtr	; 3
    296  78ed		       f0 14		      beq	nextPhase	; 2/3		 blanks finished!!
    297  78ef
      0  78ef					      DEFINE_SUBROUTINE	ProcessBlankStack	;=892
      1  78ef		       00 0f	   BANK_ProcessBlankStack =	_CURRENT_BANK
      2  78ef					      SUBROUTINE
      3  78ef				   ProcessBlankStack
    299  78ef
    300  78ef		       ad 84 02 	      lda	INTIM	;4
    301  78f2		       c9 10		      cmp	#MINIMUM_SEGTIMEBLANK	;2
    302  78f4		       90 0f		      bcc	EarlyAbort	;2/3
      0  78f6					      STRESS_TIME	MINIMUM_SEGTIMEBLANK
      1  78f6				  -	      IF	TEST_MINIMUM_SEGTIMEBLANK = 1
      2  78f6				  -
      3  78f6				  -
      4  78f6				  -
      5  78f6				  -
      6  78f6				  -
      7  78f6				  -	      echo	"***** WARNING! STRESS_TIME enabled @", ., "! *****"
      8  78f6				  -	      bne	. - 7
      9  78f6					      ENDIF
    304  78f6
    305  78f6		       a9 08		      lda	#BANK_DRAW_BUFFERS	;2
    306  78f8		       85 3e		      sta	SET_BANK_RAM	;3
    307  78fa		       85 c4		      sta	RAM_Bank	;3
    308  78fc		       20 93 f2 	      jsr	BlankCreatureInsertion	;6+853
    309  78ff
    310  78ff		       c6 8d	   NextBlank  dec	BlankStackPtr	;5		 one less object on the blank stack
    311  7901		       d0 ec		      bne	ProcessBlankStack	;2/3
    312  7903
    313  7903		       e6 8e	   nextPhase  inc	ScreenDrawPhase	;5		 obj/blank finished -- let the draw stuff proceed
    314  7905		       60	   EarlyAbort rts		;6
    315  7906
    316  7906
    317  7906
    318  7906							;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
    319  7906
      0  7906					      DEFINE_SUBROUTINE	SwitchObjects	;=72
      1  7906		       00 0f	   BANK_SwitchObjects =	_CURRENT_BANK
      2  7906					      SUBROUTINE
      3  7906				   SwitchObjects
    321  7906							; TJ: used by:
    322  7906							; - BANK_FIXED.asm
    323  7906
    324  7906							; The game loop has come to an end. The only possible "still happening" thing is the sort, which runs
    325  7906							; in parallel with other processes (objects, draw stack, etc). We may or may not want to wait for the
    326  7906							; sort to complete.  This code does all the checks needed to switch to the next game frame.
    327  7906
    328  7906		       ad 84 02 	      lda	INTIM	; 4
    329  7909		       c9 03		      cmp	#SEGTIME_SWITCHOBJECTS	; 2
    330  790b		       90 f8		      bcc	EarlyAbort	; 2/3= 8
      0  790d					      STRESS_TIME	SEGTIME_SWITCHOBJECTS
      1  790d				  -	      IF	TEST_SEGTIME_SWITCHOBJECTS = 1
      2  790d				  -
      3  790d				  -
      4  790d				  -
      5  790d				  -
      6  790d				  -
      7  790d				  -	      echo	"***** WARNING! STRESS_TIME enabled @", ., "! *****"
      8  790d				  -	      bne	. - 7
      9  790d					      ENDIF
    332  790d
    333  790d							; If we're undertime, then abort. The sort will continue to run, and that's great. Only when
    334  790d							; we're at the throttle cutoff do we switch game-frames.
    335  790d
    336  790d							;sec
    337  790d		       a5 b3		      lda	Throttle	;3
    338  790f		       e9 a0		      sbc	#MAX_THROTTLE	;2
    339  7911		       90 f2		      bcc	EarlyAbort	;2/3		 plenty of time left!
    340  7913
    341  7913							; Time is up. But we may be in a cave which requires perfect sorting (e.g., intermission 4)
    342  7913							; So we check for these caves, and wait for the sort to complete for those.
    343  7913
    344  7913		       24 b2		      bit	caveDisplay	;3
    345  7915		       50 08		      bvc	keepFractional	;2/3		 screen does not require complete sort
    346  7917
    347  7917							; We have an intermission or screen which requires the sort to go to completion
    348  7917							; Check to see if the sort is finished...
    349  7917
    350  7917		       a4 d4		      ldy	sortPtr	;3
    351  7919		       d0 ea		      bne	EarlyAbort	;2/3		 sort still in progress, so wait
    352  791b		       a4 d3		      ldy	sortRequired	;3
    353  791d		       10 e6		      bpl	EarlyAbort	;2/3		 sort still in progress, so wait
    354  791f
    355  791f		       85 b3	   keepFractional sta	Throttle	;3		 save fractional 'left over' bit
    356  7921
    357  7921
    358  7921							; Pause the game with B/W switch:
    359  7921
    360  7921		       a5 80		      lda	gameMode
    361  7923							;		  ora LookingAround		  ; New behavour of looking around pauses creatures when activated.
    362  7923		       30 14		      bmi	.paused	; pause flag set
    363  7925
    364  7925							; Now that we have completed processing both the object and blanks stacks, we switch
    365  7925							; the stack bank pointers for the next time around.
    366  7925
    367  7925		       a5 8a		      lda	ObjStackNum	;3
    368  7927		       49 01		      eor	#1	;2
    369  7929		       aa		      tax		;2
    370  792a		       86 8a		      stx	ObjStackNum	;3		 swap stacks @here
    371  792c
    372  792c							; STOP the sort so it doesn't corrupt the "other" object stack. Sort may get a look-in immediately after
    373  792c							; this code is finished, so we don't want it to do something unexpected!
    374  792c
    375  792c		       a0 ff		      ldy	#<(-1)	;2
    376  792e		       84 d3		      sty	sortRequired	;3
    377  7930		       c8		      iny		;2		 Y==0
    378  7931		       84 d4		      sty	sortPtr	;3
    379  7933
    380  7933							; Initialise the iterator and stack pointer for next time around.
    381  7933							; Previously the stack pointer auto-initialised by popping the stack. Now we have an iterator it's
    382  7933							; necessary to initialise both.
    383  7933
    384  7933		       84 dd		      sty	ObjIterator	;3		 Y==0
    385  7935		       94 8b		      sty	ObjStackPtr,x	;4
    386  7937
    387  7937		       84 8e		      sty	ScreenDrawPhase	;3
    388  7939				   .paused
    389  7939		       60	   quickExit  rts		;6
    390  793a
    391  793a							;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
    392  793a
      0  793a					      DEFINE_SUBROUTINE	PROCESS_MAN
      1  793a		       00 0f	   BANK_PROCESS_MAN =	_CURRENT_BANK
      2  793a					      SUBROUTINE
      3  793a				   PROCESS_MAN
    394  793a							; TJ: used by:

    398  793d		       c9 18		      cmp	#SEGTIME_MAN
    399  793f		       90 c4		      bcc	EarlyAbort
      0  7941					      STRESS_TIME	SEGTIME_MAN
      1  7941				  -	      IF	TEST_SEGTIME_MAN = 1
      2  7941				  -
      3  7941				  -
      4  7941				  -
      5  7941				  -
      6  7941				  -
      7  7941				  -	      echo	"***** WARNING! STRESS_TIME enabled @", ., "! *****"
      8  7941				  -	      bne	. - 7
      9  7941					      ENDIF

    404  7945		       20 18 f4 	      jsr	GetJoystickForDemoMode	; 2 player/2 joysticks
    405  7948

    407  794a		       85 c3		      sta	ROM_Bank
    408  794c		       85 3f		      sta	SET_BANK
    409  794e		       20 96 f1 	      jsr	ManProcess
    410  7951
    411  7951		       20 3d fa 	      jsr	MovePlayer	; 6+{}
    412  7954

    414  7956		       10 e1		      bpl	quickExit	; time problem (e.g., bigbang)
    415  7958

    428  796d		       4c e1 f9    gnobj      jmp	NextObject
    429  7970
    430  7970							;---------------------------------------------------------------------------

      0  7970					      DEFINE_SUBROUTINE	BlankOriginalLocation	;=93[-2](A)

    439  7974
      0  7974					      DEFINE_SUBROUTINE	BlankOriginalLocationXY	;=87[-2](A)

      2  7974					      SUBROUTINE
      3  7974				   BlankOriginalLocationXY
    441  7974
    442  7974		       a9 08		      lda	#BANK_BoardLineStartLO	;2
    443  7976		       85 3f		      sta	SET_BANK	;3
    444  7978
    445  7978		       bd 01 f0 	      lda	BoardLineStartLO,x	;4
    446  797b		       85 c1		      sta	Board_AddressW	;3
    447  797d		       bd 2d f0 	      lda	BoardLineStartHiW,x	;4
    448  7980		       85 c2		      sta	Board_AddressW+1	;3 WRITE address
    449  7982				  -	      IF	MULTI_BANK_BOARD = YES
    450  7982				  -	      lda	BoardBank,x	;4 switch this on return

    452  7982		       a9 0d		      lda	#BANK_BOARD	;2
    453  7984					      ENDIF
    454  7984		       85 3e		      sta	SET_BANK_RAM	;3
    455  7986
    456  7986		       a9 00		      lda	#CHARACTER_BLANK	;2
    457  7988		       91 c1		      sta	(Board_AddressW),y	;6 clear vacated board position
    458  798a
    459  798a		       a9 08		      lda	#BANK_DRAW_BUFFERS	;2
    460  798c		       85 3e		      sta	SET_BANK_RAM	;3
    461  798e		       20 f0 f1 	      jsr	InsertBlankStack	;6+30(A)
    462  7991
    463  7991		       a5 c3		      lda	ROM_Bank	;3
    464  7993		       85 3f		      sta	SET_BANK	;3
    465  7995
    466  7995				   EarlyAbortBOX
    467  7995
    468  7995		       60		      rts		;6
    469  7996
    470  7996							;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
    471  7996
    472  7996							; IF the creature runs out of time to do stuff, then rts HOWEVER the creature must eventually do something
    473  7996							;  as it will be continually called in available time-slices until it does. This can lockup the system.
    474  7996
    475  7996							; if the creature is done, and is alive next cycle, then jump ReInsertObject
    476  7996
    477  7996							; if the creature dies then jump NextObject
    478  7996
    479  7996
      0  7996					      DEFINE_SUBROUTINE	PROCESS_BOX
      1  7996		       00 0f	   BANK_PROCESS_BOX =	_CURRENT_BANK
      2  7996					      SUBROUTINE
      3  7996				   PROCESS_BOX
      0  7996					      DEFINE_SUBROUTINE	PROCESS_DIAMOND
      1  7996		       00 0f	   BANK_PROCESS_DIAMOND =	_CURRENT_BANK
      2  7996					      SUBROUTINE
      3  7996				   PROCESS_DIAMOND
    482  7996							; TJ: used by:
    483  7996							; - BANK_INITBANK.asm
    484  7996
    485  7996		       ad 84 02 	      lda	INTIM	;4
    486  7999		       c9 05		      cmp	#SEGTIME_BOX1	;2
    487  799b		       90 f8		      bcc	EarlyAbortBOX	;2/3
      0  799d					      STRESS_TIME	SEGTIME_BOX1
      1  799d				  -	      IF	TEST_SEGTIME_BOX1 = 1
      2  799d				  -
      3  799d				  -
      4  799d				  -
      5  799d				  -
      6  799d				  -
      7  799d				  -	      echo	"***** WARNING! STRESS_TIME enabled @", ., "! *****"
      8  799d				  -	      bne	. - 7
      9  799d					      ENDIF
    489  799d
    490  799d		       a5 8f		      lda	POS_X	;3
    491  799f		       85 91		      sta	POS_X_NEW	;3
    492  79a1		       a4 90		      ldy	POS_Y	;3
    493  79a3		       84 92		      sty	POS_Y_NEW	;3
    494  79a5
    495  79a5							; Make sure the character we're working with is still the same type of object
    496  79a5							; (for example, a 'BOX' placed on the object stack by the blank stack
    497  79a5							; handler, may no longer be there, so it's really a dummy).
    498  79a5
    499  79a5							;ldy POS_Y			  ;3
    500  79a5
    501  79a5		       a9 08		      lda	#BANK_GetBoardAddressR	;
    502  79a7		       85 3f		      sta	SET_BANK	;
    503  79a9		       20 db f0 	      jsr	GetBoardAddressR	;11+24[-2](A)
    504  79ac		       85 3e		      sta	SET_BANK_RAM	;3
    505  79ae
    506  79ae		       a4 8f		      ldy	POS_X	;3
    507  79b0		       b3 bf		      lax	(Board_AddressR),y	;5
    508  79b2		       bd e6 fc 	      lda	CharToType,x	;4
    509  79b5		       c5 93		      cmp	POS_Type	;3
    510  79b7		       d0 b4		      bne	gnobj	;2/3
    511  79b9
    512  79b9		       4c bd f9 	      jmp	NotStraightDown	; Sokoban ovveride
    513  79bc
    514  79bc
    515  79bc				   NotEnoughTime2
    516  79bc		       60		      rts
    517  79bd
    518  79bd				   NotStraightDown
    519  79bd		       ad 84 02 	      lda	INTIM
    520  79c0		       c9 08		      cmp	#SEGTIME_BOX3
    521  79c2		       90 f8		      bcc	NotEnoughTime2
      0  79c4					      STRESS_TIME	SEGTIME_BOX3
      1  79c4				  -	      IF	TEST_SEGTIME_BOX3 = 1
      2  79c4				  -
      3  79c4				  -
      4  79c4				  -
      5  79c4				  -
      6  79c4				  -
      7  79c4				  -	      echo	"***** WARNING! STRESS_TIME enabled @", ., "! *****"
      8  79c4				  -	      bne	. - 7
      9  79c4					      ENDIF
    523  79c4
    524  79c4				   ProcessBD
    525  79c4
    526  79c4							; Depending on the character UNDER this object (since this object can't fall straight
    527  79c4							; down), we either fall sideways or not.  Currently we fall if the object we are
    528  79c4							; on top of is a 'rounded' object AND the two sideways squares are blank.
    529  79c4
    530  79c4							; Note that the object under us may be a NON-ROUNDED (=FALLING) BOX/diamond
    531  79c4
    532  79c4							;;lda GenericCharFlag,x	       ; is the object we're sitting on 'rounded'?
    533  79c4							;;and #GENERIC_MASK_ROUNDED
    534  79c4							;;bne mayRoundOff
    535  79c4
    536  79c4							; Could have been FALLING character/object type, so replace with a default character on the board
    537  79c4
    538  79c4				   ReplaceFallingChar
    539  79c4
    540  79c4		       a4 90		      ldy	POS_Y
    541  79c6
    542  79c6		       a9 08		      lda	#BANK_GetBoardAddressW	;
    543  79c8		       85 3f		      sta	SET_BANK	;
    544  79ca		       20 0d f1 	      jsr	GetBoardAddressW	;11+24[-2](A)
    545  79cd		       86 3e		      stx	SET_BANK_RAM	;3
    546  79cf
    547  79cf		       a4 8f		      ldy	POS_X
    548  79d1		       a6 93		      ldx	POS_Type
    549  79d3		       bd c4 fc 	      lda	BaseTypeCharacter,x	; original character base character
    550  79d6		       91 c1		      sta	(Board_AddressW),y	; draw object in new location (Y = new X posn)
    551  79d8
    552  79d8							; We have just...
    553  79d8							; a) Rolled off a rounded object, or...  (TJ, TODO: Original makes no sound here)
    554  79d8							; b) Hit an object which we can't squash
    555  79d8							; So, play a terminating sound but only if the object was already falling
    556  79d8
    557  79d8		       20 e6 f9 	      jsr	StartSoundCheckAlreadyFalling
    558  79db				   silentAlways
    559  79db		       4c e1 f9    wasNotFalling jmp	NextObject	; no, so we can't roll off it. Object becomes quiescent.
    560  79de
    561  79de							; The object underneath is rounded, so we may roll off it.  We preferentially roll
    562  79de							; to the left.  Rolling involves moving sideways if the square to the side is blank AND
    563  79de							; the one below that one is squashable.  Here we get the 4 squares which will be
    564  79de							; involved in the calcs...
    565  79de							;;mayRoundOff					       ; y == POS_X
    566  79de							;;		   dey
    567  79de							;;		   lda (Board_AddressR),y	       ; leftward of row UNDERNEATH
    568  79de							;;		   sta BOXLeft
    569  79de							;;		   iny
    570  79de							;;		   iny
    571  79de							;;		   lda (Board_AddressR),y
    572  79de							;;		   sta BOXRight 		   ; rightward of row UNDERNEATH
    573  79de
    574  79de							;;		   ldy POS_Y
    575  79de
    576  79de							;;		   lda #BANK_GetBoardAddressR	       ;
    577  79de							;;		   sta SET_BANK 		       ;
    578  79de							;;		   jsr GetBoardAddressR 	       ;11+24[-2](A)
    579  79de							;;		   sta SET_BANK_RAM		       ;3
    580  79de
    581  79de							;;		   ldy POS_X
    582  79de							;;		   dey
    583  79de							;;		   lda (Board_AddressR),y	       ; leftward of current row
    584  79de
    585  79de							;;		   ora BOXLeft			   ; check for the movement left/down
    586  79de							;;		   bne MayRollRight		       ; there must be NOTHING in the left squares
    587  79de
    588  79de							;;		   dec POS_X_NEW		       ; new position (LEFT)
    589  79de							;;		   bpl BlankDownSound		       ; unconditional
    590  79de
    591  79de							;;MayRollRight
    592  79de
    593  79de							; check for the movement right/down
    594  79de							;;		   iny
    595  79de							;;		   iny
    596  79de							;;		   lda (Board_AddressR),y	       ; rightward of current row
    597  79de							;;		   ora BOXRight
    598  79de							;;		   bne ReplaceFallingChar	       ; there must be NOTHING in the right squares
    599  79de
    600  79de							;;		   inc POS_X_NEW		       ; new position (RIGHT)
    601  79de
    602  79de							;;BlankDownSound:
    603  79de
    604  79de							;;		   jsr StartSoundCheckAlreadyFalling   ; prevent a sound if the object wasn't already falling
    605  79de							;;		   lda #VAR_FALLING		       ; this prevents a sound in the following
    606  79de							;;		   sta POS_VAR			       ; ...call to StartSoundCheckFalling
    607  79de
    608  79de							;;BlankDown
    609  79de
    610  79de							;;		   lda INTIM
    611  79de							;;		   cmp #SEGTIME_BOX4
    612  79de							;;		   bcc NotEnoughTime
    613  79de							;;		   STRESS_TIME SEGTIME_BOX4
    614  79de
    615  79de							; The object is 'falling' into position (POS_X_NEW,POS_Y_NEW)
    616  79de							; object starts falling, so we play a sound here too:
    617  79de
    618  79de							;;		   lda #<(~VAR_FALLING) 	       ; do not start if already falling
    619  79de							;;		   jsr StartSoundCheckFalling
    620  79de
    621  79de							;;		   lda #VAR_FALLING
    622  79de							;;		   sta POS_VAR
    623  79de
    624  79de							;lda POS_VAR
    625  79de							;ora #VAR_FALLING
    626  79de							;sta POS_VAR			      ; indicate object *is* falling
    627  79de
    628  79de							;;		   jsr BlankOriginalLocation	   ;6+97(A)	   blank/stack previous position
    629  79de
    630  79de							;;		   ldy POS_Y_NEW
    631  79de							;;		   sty POS_Y
    632  79de
    633  79de							;;		   lda #BANK_GetBoardAddressW	       ;
    634  79de							;;		   sta SET_BANK 		       ;
    635  79de							;;		   jsr GetBoardAddressW 	       ;11+24[-2](A)
    636  79de							;;		   stx SET_BANK_RAM		       ;3
    637  79de
    638  79de							;;		   ldy POS_X_NEW
    639  79de							;;		   sty POS_X
    640  79de
    641  79de							;;		   ldx POS_Type
    642  79de							;;		   lda BaseTypeCharacterFalling,x		; original character base character
    643  79de							;;		   sta (Board_AddressW),y			; draw object in new location (Y = new X posn)
    644  79de
    645  79de		       20 0b fa    ReInsertObject jsr	InsertObjectStack	; 6+76(B)  = 98 (if jumping here)	  place on stack so it keeps moving
    646  79e1
    647  79e1				   NextObject
    648  79e1		       e6 dd		      inc	ObjIterator	; 5
    649  79e3							;		  dec ObjStackPtr,x		  ; 6
    650  79e3		       4c a9 f8 	      jmp	ProcessObjStack	; 3 = 16
    651  79e6
    652  79e6							;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
    653  79e6
      0  79e6					      DEFINE_SUBROUTINE	StartSoundCheckAlreadyFalling
      1  79e6		       00 0f	   BANK_StartSoundCheckAlreadyFalling =	_CURRENT_BANK
      2  79e6					      SUBROUTINE
      3  79e6				   StartSoundCheckAlreadyFalling
    655  79e6							; TJ: used by:
    656  79e6							; - BANK_FIXED.asm
    657  79e6		       a9 80		      lda	#VAR_FALLING	; play ONLY if we were already falling
      0  79e8					      DEFINE_SUBROUTINE	StartSoundCheckFalling
      1  79e8		       00 0f	   BANK_StartSoundCheckFalling =	_CURRENT_BANK
      2  79e8					      SUBROUTINE
      3  79e8				   StartSoundCheckFalling
    659  79e8		       45 94		      eor	POS_VAR	; check if already falling or not
    660  79ea		       30 11		      bmi	.noSound	; <--- DANGEROUS assumption of flag value
      0  79ec					      DEFINE_SUBROUTINE	StartSoundAlways
      1  79ec		       00 0f	   BANK_StartSoundAlways =	_CURRENT_BANK
      2  79ec					      SUBROUTINE
      3  79ec				   StartSoundAlways
    662  79ec		       a4 93		      ldy	POS_Type
    663  79ee		       a5 db		      lda	newSounds
    664  79f0		       29 0f		      and	#SND_MASK_LO	; already a new sound triggerd?
    665  79f2		       c9 03		      cmp	#SOUND_MOVE_SOIL+1	; except for low priority move sounds!
    666  79f4		       b0 07		      bcs	.noSound	; yes, no new sound
    667  79f6		       45 db		      eor	newSounds
    668  79f8		       19 fd f9 	      ora	FallSoundTbl-TYPE_BOX,y
    669  79fb		       85 db		      sta	newSounds
    670  79fd				   .noSound
    671  79fd		       60		      rts
    672  79fe
    673  79fe							;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
    674  79fe
    675  79fe							; Warning: Hardwired dependence on existing TYPE_
    676  79fe							; sounds are played when BOXs/diamonds start *and* end falling:
    677  79fe				   FallSoundTbl
    678  79fe							; TJ: used by:
    679  79fe							; - BANK_FIXED.asm
    680  79fe		       03		      .byte.b	SOUND_BOX	; TYPE_BOX
    681  79ff		       00		      .byte.b	0
    682  7a00		       00		      .byte.b	0
    683  7a01		       00		      .byte.b	0

    685  7a03

    687  7a03
      0  7a03					      DEFINE_SUBROUTINE	InsertObjectStackFromRAM	;=94(B)
      1  7a03		       00 0f	   BANK_InsertObjectStackFromRAM =	_CURRENT_BANK
      2  7a03					      SUBROUTINE
      3  7a03				   InsertObjectStackFromRAM
    689  7a03							; TJ: used by:

    694  7a06		       a5 c4		      lda	RAM_Bank	;3

      0  7a0b					      DEFINE_SUBROUTINE	InsertObjectStack	;=81(B)

      2  7a0b					      SUBROUTINE
      3  7a0b				   InsertObjectStack
    702  7a0b							; TJ: used by:
    703  7a0b							; - BANK_FIXED.asm
    704  7a0b							; - BANK_INITBANK.asm
    705  7a0b
    706  7a0b							; POS_X     x position
    707  7a0b							; POS_Y     y position
    708  7a0b							; POS_VAR   direction or other variable
    709  7a0b							; POS_Type  type of object
    710  7a0b
    711  7a0b		       a6 8a		      ldx	ObjStackNum	; 3
    712  7a0d		       bc 3b fa 	      ldy	BankObjStack,x	; 4
    713  7a10		       84 3e		      sty	SET_BANK_RAM	; 3
    714  7a12		       b4 8b		      ldy	ObjStackPtr,x	; 4 = 14
    715  7a14
    716  7a14
    717  7a14		       a5 90		      lda	POS_Y	; 3
    718  7a16		       99 80 14 	      sta	ObjStackY+RAM_WRITE,y	; 5
    719  7a19		       a5 8f		      lda	POS_X	; 3
    720  7a1b		       99 00 14 	      sta	ObjStackX+RAM_WRITE,y	; 5
    721  7a1e		       a5 94		      lda	POS_VAR	; 3
    722  7a20		       99 00 15 	      sta	ObjStackVar+RAM_WRITE,y	; 5
    723  7a23		       a5 93		      lda	POS_Type	; 3
    724  7a25		       99 00 16 	      sta	ObjStackType+RAM_WRITE,y	; 5 = 32
    725  7a28
    726  7a28							; Nice addition limits overflow of the stack, BUT always reserves a spot for the man.
    727  7a28							; Objects are unceremoniously dumped when there's not enough space.  This is just trying to cater
    728  7a28							; for a no-win situation. Try and preserve the player at the cost of correct gameplay. Avoid crashing.
    729  7a28
    730  7a28
    731  7a28				  -	      IF	TYPE_MAN != 0
    732  7a28				  -	      cmp	#TYPE_MAN	; 2
    733  7a28					      ENDIF
    734  7a28		       f0 04		      beq	alwaysAllowMan	; 2/3
    735  7a2a
    736  7a2a		       c0 7e		      cpy	#OBJ_STACK_SIZE-2	; 2	     reserve 1 last-gasp slot for man only
    737  7a2c		       b0 08		      bcs	insertDone	; 2/3= 6    no room -- drop object
    738  7a2e				   alwaysAllowMan
    739  7a2e
    740  7a2e		       98		      tya		; 2
    741  7a2f		       99 80 15 	      sta	SortedObjPtr+RAM_WRITE,y	; 5	     indirection pointer for later sorting
    742  7a32
    743  7a32		       f6 8b		      inc	ObjStackPtr,x	; 7	     overflow is assumed not to happen!
    744  7a34					      IF	SORT_OBJECTS = YES
    745  7a34		       84 d3		      sty	sortRequired	; 3	     flag that a sort is required
    746  7a36					      ENDIF
    747  7a36
    748  7a36		       a4 c3	   insertDone ldy	ROM_Bank	; 3
    749  7a38		       84 3f		      sty	SET_BANK	; 3
    750  7a3a
    751  7a3a		       60	   ManIsDead2 rts		; 6 = 29
    752  7a3b
    753  7a3b							;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
    754  7a3b
    755  7a3b		       0b 0c	   BankObjStack .byte.b	BANK_OBJSTACK, BANK_OBJSTACK2
    756  7a3d							; TJ: used by:
    757  7a3d							; - BANK_FIXED.asm
    758  7a3d
    759  7a3d							;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
    760  7a3d
    761  7a3d
    762  7a3d				   MovePlayer
    763  7a3d							; TJ: used by:
    764  7a3d							; - BANK_FIXED.asm
    765  7a3d							; - BANK_INITBANK.asm
    766  7a3d		       a5 a3		      lda	ManMode
    767  7a3f		       c9 02		      cmp	#MANMODE_DEAD
    768  7a41		       b0 f7		      bcs	ManIsDead2
    769  7a43
    770  7a43		       a4 92		      ldy	POS_Y_NEW
    771  7a45
    772  7a45		       a9 08		      lda	#BANK_GetBoardAddressRW	;2
    773  7a47		       85 3f		      sta	SET_BANK	;3
    774  7a49		       85 c3		      sta	ROM_Bank	;3
    775  7a4b		       20 c8 f0 	      jsr	GetBoardAddressRW	;6+32[-2]
    776  7a4e				  -	      IF	MULTI_BANK_BOARD = YES
    777  7a4e				  -	      stx	RAM_Bank
    778  7a4e					      ENDIF
    779  7a4e		       86 3e		      stx	SET_BANK_RAM	; 3
    780  7a50
    781  7a50		       a4 91		      ldy	POS_X_NEW
    782  7a52		       b3 bf		      lax	(Board_AddressR),y
    783  7a54							; TODO: would it makes sense to add a move conversion table?
    784  7a54							; that way, the move tables would become much smaller
    785  7a54		       a9 08		      lda	#BANK_MoveVecLO
    786  7a56		       85 3f		      sta	SET_BANK
    787  7a58
    788  7a58		       bd 4c f4 	      lda	MoveVecLO,x
    789  7a5b		       85 df		      sta	MAN_Move
    790  7a5d		       bd 67 f4 	      lda	MoveVecHI,x
    791  7a60		       85 e0		      sta	MAN_Move+1
    792  7a62
    793  7a62				  -	      IF	MULTI_BANK_BOARD = YES
    794  7a62				  -	      lda	RAM_Bank
    795  7a62					      ELSE
    796  7a62		       a9 0d		      lda	#BANK_BOARD
    797  7a64					      ENDIF
    798  7a64		       85 3e		      sta	SET_BANK_RAM
    799  7a66		       6c df 00 	      jmp	(MAN_Move)
    800  7a69
    801  7a69							;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
    802  7a69
    803  7a69
    804  7a69				   MOVE_DIAMOND
    805  7a69							; TJ: used by:

    810  7a6e		       66 dc		      ror	specialTimeFlag	; mark any overtime!
    811  7a70		       10 4d		      bpl	timeExit
      0  7a72					      STRESS_TIME	SEGTIME_GET_DIAMOND
      1  7a72				  -	      IF	TEST_SEGTIME_GET_DIAMOND = 1
      2  7a72				  -
      3  7a72				  -
      4  7a72				  -
      5  7a72				  -

      8  7a72				  -	      bne	. - 7
      9  7a72					      ENDIF
    813  7a72
    814  7a72
    815  7a72				  -	      IF	MULTI_BANK_BOARD = YES
    816  7a72				  -	      lda	RAM_Bank
    817  7a72					      ELSE
    818  7a72		       a9 0d		      lda	#BANK_BOARD
    819  7a74					      ENDIF
    820  7a74		       85 3e		      sta	SET_BANK_RAM
    821  7a76		       10 1c		      bpl	checkForSnatch	;3		 unconditional
    822  7a78
    823  7a78							;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
    824  7a78
    825  7a78				   MOVE_BLANK
    826  7a78							; TJ: used by:
    827  7a78							; - BANK_FIXED.asm
    828  7a78
    829  7a78							; The movement sounds are lowest priority. They only trigger if there is a free channel.
    830  7a78							; The code below checks the two channels and if either is free, uses it for the move sound.
    831  7a78
    832  7a78		       a0 01		      ldy	#SOUND_MOVE_BLANK	; 2
      0  7a7a					      NOP_W		; 2
      1  7a7a		       0c		      .byte.b	$0c
    834  7a7b		       a0 02	   MOVE_SOIL  ldy	#SOUND_MOVE_SOIL	; 2
    835  7a7d							; TJ: used by:
    836  7a7d							; - BANK_FIXED.asm
    837  7a7d
    838  7a7d							; lowest priority, look for a free channel, 0 first
    839  7a7d
    840  7a7d		       a7 db		      lax	newSounds
    841  7a7f		       29 0f		      and	#SND_MASK_LO
    842  7a81		       d0 03		      bne	.skipUseLow	;		 LO channel is not available
    843  7a83
    844  7a83		       98		      tya
    845  7a84		       d0 0a		      bne	.setSound	;		 unconditional: USE lo channel!
    846  7a86
    847  7a86				   .skipUseLow
    848  7a86		       8a		      txa
    849  7a87		       29 f0		      and	#SND_MASK_HI
    850  7a89		       d0 09		      bne	checkForSnatch	;2/3		 no channel available so skip sound
    851  7a8b
    852  7a8b		       98		      tya
    853  7a8c		       0a		      asl
    854  7a8d		       0a		      asl
    855  7a8e		       0a		      asl
    856  7a8f		       0a		      asl		;		 use requested sound in Hi channel
    857  7a90
    858  7a90		       05 db	   .setSound  ora	newSounds
    859  7a92		       85 db		      sta	newSounds
    860  7a94
    861  7a94							;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
    862  7a94							; Handle snatching...
    863  7a94
    864  7a94				   checkForSnatch
    865  7a94
    866  7a94
    867  7a94		       a4 91		      ldy	POS_X_NEW	; 3
    868  7a96		       a5 97		      lda	BufferedButton	; 3		 button pressed?
    869  7a98		       30 0a		      bmi	MoveNoButton	; 2/3		 NO, so we move to new square, otherwise...
    870  7a9a
    871  7a9a							; We only 'snatch' and the player doesn't move. Blank the snatched square...
    872  7a9a
    873  7a9a		       a6 92		      ldx	POS_Y_NEW	; 3
    874  7a9c		       86 90		      stx	POS_Y	; 3		 needed for InsertBlankStack
    875  7a9e		       84 8f		      sty	POS_X	; 3		 needed for InsertBlankStack
    876  7aa0							;jmp BlankOriginalLocationXY	  ; 6+87[-2](A)   snatch/grab the new location
    877  7aa0
    878  7aa0							;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
    879  7aa0
    880  7aa0				   MoveNoButton2
    881  7aa0							; TJ: used by:
    882  7aa0							; - BANK_ROM_SHADOW_DRAWBUFFERS.asm
    883  7aa0		       a9 0d		      lda	#BANK_BOARD
    884  7aa2		       85 3e		      sta	SET_BANK_RAM
    885  7aa4
    886  7aa4		       a9 06	   MoveNoButton lda	#CHARACTER_MANOCCUPIED	; 2
    887  7aa6		       91 c1		      sta	(Board_AddressW),y	; 6 =	8	 the man's new square
    888  7aa8
    889  7aa8		       a6 a0		      ldx	ManY	; 3
    890  7aaa		       86 90		      stx	POS_Y	; 3
    891  7aac		       a4 9f		      ldy	ManX	; 3
    892  7aae		       84 8f		      sty	POS_X	; 3 = 12
    893  7ab0
    894  7ab0		       20 74 f9 	      jsr	BlankOriginalLocationXY	; 6+87[-2](A)	 and stacks newly blank position for checking
    895  7ab3
    896  7ab3		       a5 91		      lda	POS_X_NEW	; 3
    897  7ab5		       85 9f		      sta	ManX	; 3
    898  7ab7		       a5 92		      lda	POS_Y_NEW	; 3
    899  7ab9		       85 a0		      sta	ManY	; 3 = 12	 actually MOVE!
    900  7abb
    901  7abb				   MOVE_GENERIC

    905  7abd		       85 a9		      sta	ManPushCounter	; 3
    906  7abf		       60	   timeExit   rts		; 6 = 11

      2  7ace					      SUBROUTINE
      3  7ace				   StealCharDraw
    931  7ace							; TJ: used by:

    934  7ace		       a9 08		      lda	#BANK_DRAW_BUFFERS	; 2

    941  7ad6							; fall through...
    942  7ad6
    943  7ad6							;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
    944  7ad6
      0  7ad6					      DEFINE_SUBROUTINE	TimeSlice
      1  7ad6		       00 0f	   BANK_TimeSlice =	_CURRENT_BANK
      2  7ad6					      SUBROUTINE
      3  7ad6				   TimeSlice
    946  7ad6							; TJ: used by:
    947  7ad6							; - BANK_FIXED.asm
    948  7ad6
    949  7ad6							; FIRST check the time is sufficient for the smallest of the timeslices. Not much point
    950  7ad6							; going ahead if there's insufficient time. This allows the previous character drawing to
    951  7ad6							; be much smaller in time, as they don't have to include the timeslice code overhead.
    952  7ad6
    953  7ad6		       ad 84 02 	      lda	INTIM	; 4
    954  7ad9		       c9 05		      cmp	#SEGTIME_MINIMUM_TIMESLICE	; 2
    955  7adb		       90 e2		      bcc	timeExit	; 2(3)
    956  7add
    957  7add							; Uses the phase variable to vector to the correct processing code for the given timeslice
    958  7add							; Code may be in any bank. Avoid the fixed bank at all costs!	Once a section is complete
    959  7add							; it should increment ScreenDrawPhase.
    960  7add
    961  7add							; Switched-in bank(s) are undefined after this function is called!
    962  7add
    963  7add		       a9 07		      lda	#BANK_TS_PhaseVectorLO	; 2
    964  7adf		       85 3f		      sta	SET_BANK	; 3
    965  7ae1
    966  7ae1		       a6 8e		      ldx	ScreenDrawPhase	; 3		 current phase of drawing
    967  7ae3		       bd e0 f5 	      lda	TS_PhaseVectorLO,x	; 4
    968  7ae6		       85 df		      sta	TS_Vector	; 3
    969  7ae8		       bd e6 f5 	      lda	TS_PhaseVectorHI,x	; 4
    970  7aeb		       85 e0		      sta	TS_Vector+1	; 3
    971  7aed
    972  7aed		       bd ec f5 	      lda	TS_PhaseBank,x	; 4
    973  7af0		       85 3f		      sta	SET_BANK	; 3		 switch bank
    974  7af2
    975  7af2		       6c df 00 	      jmp	(TS_Vector)	; 3 = 40	 vector to timeslice handler
    976  7af5
    977  7af5							; = 55 minimum return time (if segtime abort)
    978  7af5
    979  7af5							;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
    980  7af5
    981  7af5
    982  7af5				   DrawAnother
    983  7af5							; TJ: used by:
    984  7af5							; - BANK_ROM_SHADOW_RAMBANK.asm
    985  7af5
    986  7af5		       a9 08		      lda	#BANK_DRAW_BUFFERS	; 2	     A = SCREEN_LINES
    987  7af7		       85 3e		      sta	SET_BANK_RAM	; 3 =	5
    988  7af9
    989  7af9		       a4 89		      ldy	DrawStackPointer	; 3 =	3    MUST have been set by BuildDrawStack!
    990  7afb
    991  7afb		       be 00 f1 	      ldx	DrawStack,y	; 4	     in actuality a character index
    992  7afe		       bd a0 f1 	      lda	ScreenBuffer,x	; 4	     new character to draw
    993  7b01		       29 7f		      and	#~128	; 2
    994  7b03		       9d a0 f5 	      sta	ScreenBuffer+RAM_WRITE,x	; 4 = 14    clear hint bit
    995  7b06
    996  7b06		       88		      dey		; 2
    997  7b07		       84 89		      sty	DrawStackPointer	; 3	     one less to draw
    998  7b09		       30 cb		      bmi	ExitStealCharDraw	; 2(3)=7
    999  7b0b
   1000  7b0b				   EnterStealCharDraw		;	     RAM bank MUST be at BANK_DRAW_BUFFERS
   1001  7b0b							; TJ: used by:
   1002  7b0b							; - BANK_FIXED.asm
   1003  7b0b
   1004  7b0b		       ad 84 02 	      lda	INTIM	; 4
   1005  7b0e		       c9 05		      cmp	#SEGTIME_SCD_MIN	; 2
   1006  7b10		       90 c4		      bcc	ExitStealCharDraw	; 2/3= 8
   1007  7b12
   1008  7b12		       be 00 f1 	      ldx	DrawStack,y	; 4	     in actuality a character index
   1009  7b15		       bc a0 f1 	      ldy	ScreenBuffer,x	; 4 =	8    new character to draw
   1010  7b18
   1011  7b18		       bd 3f f3 	      lda	ROW_BankChar,x	; 4	     A = 0..SCREEN_LINES-1
   1012  7b1b		       85 3e		      sta	SET_BANK_RAM	; 3
   1013  7b1d		       4c 53 f1 	      jmp	StealPart3	; 3 = 10    --> 18 cycles after check for SEGTIME_SCD_MIN
   1014  7b20

   1041  7b2e
   1042  7b2e							; Check the screen for all those characters that need to be redrawn
   1043  7b2e							; Just copies the mxn grid from the board to a DrawFlags array.  If the entry in
   1044  7b2e							; the drawflags array is different to the ScreenBuffer array entry, then the
   1045  7b2e							; screenbuffer will need redrawing.
   1046  7b2e
   1047  7b2e				   CopyRow2
   1048  7b2e							; TJ: used by:
   1049  7b2e							; - BANK_INITBANK.asm
   1050  7b2e
   1051  7b2e				  -	      IF	MULTI_BANK_BOARD = YES
   1052  7b2e				  -	      lda	BDF_BoardBank	; 3
   1053  7b2e					      ELSE
   1054  7b2e		       a9 0d		      lda	#BANK_BOARD	; 2	 saves 5*8 = 40 cyles
   1055  7b30					      ENDIF
   1056  7b30		       85 3e		      sta	SET_BANK_RAM	; 3
   1057  7b32		       b3 e3		      lax	(BDF_BoardAddress),y	; 5
   1058  7b34		       9a		      txs		; 2
   1059  7b35		       b3 e5		      lax	(BDF_BoardAddress2),y	; 5(= 18[-1])
   1060  7b37
   1061  7b37		       a9 08		      lda	#BANK_DRAW_BUFFERS	; 2
   1062  7b39		       85 3e		      sta	SET_BANK_RAM	; 3
   1063  7b3b		       bd d4 f2 	      lda	CharReplacement,x	; 4
   1064  7b3e		       91 e1		      sta	(BDF_DrawFlagAddress2),y	; 6
   1065  7b40		       ba		      tsx		; 2
   1066  7b41		       bd d4 f2 	      lda	CharReplacement,x	; 4
   1067  7b44		       91 df		      sta	(BDF_DrawFlagAddress),y	; 6(= 27)
   1068  7b46
   1069  7b46		       88		      dey		; 2
   1070  7b47		       10 e5		      bpl	CopyRow2	; 2/3=49/50[-1]
   1071  7b49							; total: 5*49[-1]-1 = 244[-5]
   1072  7b49
   1073  7b49							; TJ: examples for multi RAM bank access.
   1074  7b49							;CopyRow2
   1075  7b49							;		  lax (BDF_BoardAddress),y	  ; 5
   1076  7b49							;		  txs				  ; 2
   1077  7b49							;		  lax (BDF_BoardAddress2),y	  ; 5(= 12)
   1078  7b49							;		  lda CharReplacement,x 	  ; 4
   1079  7b49							;		  sta (BDF_DrawFlagAddress2),y	  ; 6
   1080  7b49							;		  tsx				  ; 2
   1081  7b49							;		  lda CharReplacement,x 	  ; 4
   1082  7b49							;		  sta (BDF_DrawFlagAddress),y	  ; 6(= 22)
   1083  7b49							;		  dey				  ; 2
   1084  7b49							;		  bpl CopyRow2			  ; 2/3=38/39
   1085  7b49							;; total: 5*39 - 1 = 194
   1086  7b49							;
   1087  7b49							;CopyRow2

   1089  7b49							;		  lda CharReplacement,x 	  ; 4
   1090  7b49							;		  sta (BDF_DrawFlagAddress),y	  ; 6(= 15)
   1091  7b49							;		  dey				  ; 2
   1092  7b49							;		  bpl CopyRow2			  ; 2/3=19/20

   1094  7b49

   1205  7ba0							; including those for general systems function. But NOT those which do not need re-initialising between

   1258  7bd3
   1259  7bd3				   NewFrameBD
   1260  7bd3							; the (at least) 220 cycles wasted in the above... bugs me!
   1261  7bd3							; the below is an unrolled version.  I've moved some other code between the sync writes, effectively saving um... 22 cycles/frame.
   1262  7bd3							; This required TIM64T values to be increased by 1 for each platform (we have actually gained back some usable time :)
   1263  7bd3
   1264  7bd3		       24 c9		      bit	NextLevelTrigger
   1265  7bd5		       10 c5		      bpl	NextCaveLevel	; game-triggered next level
   1266  7bd7		       70 af		      bvs	RestartCaveNextPlayer	; loss of life
   1267  7bd9
   1268  7bd9							; Note: VSYNC must NOT be on when starting a new cave! Else you get annoying TV signals.
   1269  7bd9		       a9 0e		      lda	#%1110	; VSYNC ON
   1270  7bdb				   .loopVSync
   1271  7bdb							;		  ldx #BANK_PlaySounds
   1272  7bdb							;		  stx SET_BANK
   1273  7bdb
   1274  7bdb							;		  ldx Platform
   1275  7bdb							;		  ldy VBlankTime,x
   1276  7bdb
   1277  7bdb		       85 42		      sta	WSYNC
   1278  7bdd		       85 40		      sta	VSYNC
   1279  7bdf
   1280  7bdf							;		  sty TIM64T			  ; better set timer after (last) WSYNC
   1281  7bdf
   1282  7bdf							; Ignorant comment removed. (TJ: and you were wrong anyway. :)
   1283  7bdf
   1284  7bdf		       4a		      lsr
   1285  7be0		       d0 f9		      bne	.loopVSync	; branch until VYSNC has been reset
   1286  7be2
   1287  7be2							; moved *after* the loop since this allows to *increase* timer values by 1!
   1288  7be2		       a6 81		      ldx	Platform
   1289  7be4		       bc 39 fc 	      ldy	VBlankTime,x
   1290  7be7		       8c 96 02 	      sty	TIM64T
   1291  7bea
   1292  7bea		       a2 00		      ldx	#BANK_PlaySounds
   1293  7bec		       86 3f		      stx	SET_BANK
   1294  7bee
   1295  7bee							;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
   1296  7bee							; Do not separate code, as bank assumption is made
   1297  7bee
   1298  7bee		       20 22 f3 	      jsr	PlaySounds	; 6+x	 Jentzsch sound system
   1299  7bf1
   1300  7bf1		       20 ce fa 	      jsr	StealCharDraw	; NOTE THIS IS THE *ONLY* AREA BIG ENOUGH FOR > 30 INTIM NEEDS
   1301  7bf4					      IF	SORT_OBJECTS = YES
   1302  7bf4		       20 35 fd 	      jsr	SortObjects2	; 6+15 mininum. Opportunistic sorting
   1303  7bf7					      ENDIF
   1304  7bf7
   1305  7bf7							;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
   1306  7bf7							; START OF DISPLAY
   1307  7bf7
   1308  7bf7		       a9 09		      lda	#BANK_SCORING	; 2
   1309  7bf9		       85 3e		      sta	SET_BANK_RAM	; 3
   1310  7bfb		       20 d3 f1 	      jsr	DrawDigits	; 6 = 11
   1311  7bfe
   1312  7bfe							;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
   1313  7bfe							; A 42-cycle timing window in the screen draw code.  Perform any general
   1314  7bfe							; per-frame code here, provided it takes exactly 42 cycles to execute.
   1315  7bfe							; TJ: Well, not exactly 42 cycles, but it works! :)
   1316  7bfe							;	 @09
   1317  7bfe		       85 49		      sta	COLUBK	; 3	 value comes from subroutine
   1318  7c00							; + the 'black' left-side of top screen colour change when look-around is actually a HMOVE bar, so we can't fix it :)
   1319  7c00
   1320  7c00
   1321  7c00							;		  inc Throttle		      ; 5     speed limiter
      0  7c00					      SLEEP	5	;	 TODO: optimize for space
      1  7c00				   .CYCLES    SET	5
      2  7c00
      3  7c00				  -	      IF	.CYCLES < 2
      4  7c00				  -	      ECHO	"MACRO ERROR: 'SLEEP': Duration must be > 1"
      5  7c00				  -	      ERR
      6  7c00					      ENDIF
      7  7c00
      8  7c00					      IF	.CYCLES & 1
      9  7c00					      IFNCONST	NO_ILLEGAL_OPCODES
     10  7c00		       04 00		      nop	0
     11  7c02				  -	      ELSE
     12  7c02				  -	      bit	VSYNC
     13  7c02					      ENDIF
     14  7c02				   .CYCLES    SET	.CYCLES - 3
     15  7c02					      ENDIF
     16  7c02
     17  7c02					      REPEAT	.CYCLES / 2
     18  7c02		       ea		      nop
     19  7c03					      REPEND
   1323  7c03
   1324  7c03		       a9 15		      lda	#%00010101	; 2	 double width missile, double width player
   1325  7c05		       ca		      dex		; 2	 = $6f, stars effect!
   1326  7c06		       86 62		      stx	HMM0	; 3	 @24, exactly 21 cycles after the HMOVE
   1327  7c08
   1328  7c08		       85 44		      sta	NUSIZ0	; 3
   1329  7c0a		       84 65		      sty	VDELP0	; 3	 y = 0!
   1330  7c0c
   1331  7c0c		       c8		      iny		; 2	 this relies on Y == 0 before...
   1332  7c0d		       c4 c6		      cpy	extraLifeTimer	; 3	 ..,and bit 0 is set in A
   1333  7c0f		       69 02		      adc	#2	; 2
   1334  7c11		       85 5d		      sta	ENAM0	; 3	 dis/enable Cosmic Ark star effect
   1335  7c13
   1336  7c13		       a5 a8		      lda	ManLastDirection	; 3
   1337  7c15		       85 4b		      sta	REFP0	; 3
   1338  7c17
   1339  7c17		       a9 00		      lda	#BANK_SCREENMARKII1	; 2
   1340  7c19		       85 3e		      sta	SET_BANK_RAM	; 3
   1341  7c1b		       20 00 f0 	      jsr	DrawTheScreen	; 6	 @57 from RAM, no less!!
   1342  7c1e							;	 @66
   1343  7c1e		       a9 07		      lda	#BANK_PostScreenCleanup	; 2
   1344  7c20		       85 3f		      sta	SET_BANK	; 3
   1345  7c22		       20 fa f5 	      jsr	PostScreenCleanup	; 6+x
   1346  7c25
   1347  7c25		       a9 04		      lda	#BANK_SelfModDrawPlayers	; 2
   1348  7c27		       85 3f		      sta	SET_BANK	; 3
   1349  7c29		       20 fb f2 	      jsr	SelfModDrawPlayers	; 6+x
   1350  7c2c
   1351  7c2c		       20 ce fa 	      jsr	StealCharDraw
   1352  7c2f					      IF	SORT_OBJECTS = YES
   1353  7c2f		       20 35 fd 	      jsr	SortObjects2	;6+15 minimum	Opportunistic sorting
   1354  7c32					      ENDIF
   1355  7c32
   1356  7c32		       ad 84 02    OverscanBD lda	INTIM	;4
   1357  7c35		       d0 fb		      bne	OverscanBD	;2/3
   1358  7c37		       f0 9a		      beq	NewFrameBD	;3	 unconditional
   1359  7c39
   1360  7c39				   VBlankTime

   1362  7c39							; - BANK_FIXED.asm

   1364  7c3b		       55 3e		      .byte.b	VBLANK_TIM_PAL, VBLANK_TIM_NTSC

   1598  7cd5							; Given an object type, gives a base character to use for that type
   1599  7cd5							; essentially the conversion BaseTypeCharacer[ TYPE ] --> character
   1600  7cd5
   1601  7cd5		       06		      .byte.b	CHARACTER_MANOCCUPIED
   1602  7cd6		       18		      .byte.b	CHARACTER_BOX_FALLING
   1603  7cd7		       00		      .byte.b	0
   1604  7cd8		       00		      .byte.b	0
   1605  7cd9		       00		      .byte.b	0
   1606  7cda		       19		      .byte.b	CHARACTER_DIAMOND_FALLING
   1607  7cdb		       0b		      .byte.b	CHARACTER_WALL0
   1608  7cdc		       11		      .byte.b	CHARACTER_EXITDOOR	; exit door
   1609  7cdd		       00		      .byte.b	CHARACTER_BLANK	; select
   1610  7cde		       13		      .byte.b	CHARACTER_EXPLOSION
   1611  7cdf		       14		      .byte.b	CHARACTER_EXPLOSION1
   1612  7ce0		       15		      .byte.b	CHARACTER_EXPLOSION2

   1614  7ce2		       00		      .byte.b	CHARACTER_BLANK

   1617  7ce5		       10		      .byte.b	CHARACTER_WALL

   1625  7ce6
   1626  7ce6							;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
   1627  7ce6
      0  7ce6					      DEFINE_SUBROUTINE	CharToType	; in FIXED_BANK
      1  7ce6		       00 0f	   BANK_CharToType =	_CURRENT_BANK
      2  7ce6					      SUBROUTINE
      3  7ce6				   CharToType
   1629  7ce6							; TJ: used by:
   1630  7ce6							; - BANK_FIXED.asm
   1631  7ce6							; - BANK_INITBANK.asm
   1632  7ce6
   1633  7ce6							; Converts a character # to a creature type
   1634  7ce6							; add 128 if character is NOT to be added as a creature on board draw
   1635  7ce6
   1636  7ce6		       0d		      .byte.b	TYPE_BLANK	;  0	 blank
   1637  7ce7		       0e		      .byte.b	TYPE_SOIL	;  1	 soil
   1638  7ce8		       01		      .byte.b	TYPE_BOX	;  2
   1639  7ce9		       00		      .byte.b	0	;  3
   1640  7cea		       05		      .byte.b	TYPE_DIAMOND	;  4
   1641  7ceb		       05		      .byte.b	TYPE_DIAMOND	;  5
   1642  7cec		       00		      .byte.b	TYPE_MAN	;  6
   1643  7ced		       00		      .byte.b	0	;  7
   1644  7cee		       00		      .byte.b	0	;  8
   1645  7cef		       00		      .byte.b	0	;  9
   1646  7cf0		       00		      .byte.b	0	; 0a
   1647  7cf1		       06		      .byte.b	TYPE_MAGICWALL	; 0b
   1648  7cf2		       06		      .byte.b	TYPE_MAGICWALL	; 0c
   1649  7cf3		       06		      .byte.b	TYPE_MAGICWALL	; 0d

   1651  7cf5		       0f		      .byte.b	TYPE_STEELWALL	; 0f	  ; steel wall
   1652  7cf6		       10		      .byte.b	TYPE_BRICKWALL	; 10	  ; plain brick wall
   1653  7cf7		       07		      .byte.b	TYPE_EXITDOOR	; 11
   1654  7cf8		       07		      .byte.b	TYPE_EXITDOOR	; 12
   1655  7cf9		       09		      .byte.b	TYPE_EXPLOSION	; 13
   1656  7cfa		       0a		      .byte.b	TYPE_EXPLOSION1	; 14
   1657  7cfb		       0b		      .byte.b	TYPE_EXPLOSION2	; 15
   1658  7cfc		       0c		      .byte.b	TYPE_EXPLOSION3	; 16
   1659  7cfd		       00		      .byte.b	0	; 17
   1660  7cfe

   1662  7cff		       05		      .byte.b	TYPE_DIAMOND	; falling diamond
   1663  7d00

   1665  7d01							; --> see also MoveVec

   1672  7d01
   1673  7d01							;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
   1674  7d01
      0  7d01					      DEFINE_SUBROUTINE	AnimateCharReplacements2	;139
      1  7d01		       00 0f	   BANK_AnimateCharReplacements2 =	_CURRENT_BANK
      2  7d01					      SUBROUTINE
      3  7d01				   AnimateCharReplacements2
   1676  7d01							; TJ: used by:
   1677  7d01							; - BANK_ROM_SHADOW_DRAWBUFFERS.asm
   1678  7d01
   1679  7d01							; This manages character animation on a per-object basis.  Morph/animate these
   1680  7d01							; characters individually or as required.  Change will affect all characters
   1681  7d01							; of the same type in the visible display.
   1682  7d01
   1683  7d01							; -------------------------------------------
   1684  7d01							; The door will animate when it is 'open'. It's open when the required number of diamonds have been
   1685  7d01							; collected. This in turn triggers the "extra diamonds" flag for scoring, so that is used to determine
   1686  7d01							; when the door should flash.
   1687  7d01
   1688  7d01		       24 c8		      bit	scoringFlags	;3
   1689  7d03		       10 08		      bpl	NoDoor	;2/3		 extra diamonds (D7) set when door animates
   1690  7d05
   1691  7d05		       ad e5 f2 	      lda	ANIM_EXITDOOR	;4
   1692  7d08		       49 03		      eor	#CHARACTER_EXITDOOR2^CHARACTER_EXITDOOR	;2
   1693  7d0a		       8d e5 f6 	      sta	ANIM_EXITDOOR + RAM_WRITE	;4 = 22	 exit door
   1694  7d0d				   NoDoor
   1695  7d0d
   1696  7d0d							; -------------------------------------------
   1697  7d0d
   1698  7d0d							; handle the non-mandatory animating things
   1699  7d0d
   1700  7d0d		       a5 ae		      lda	timer	;3
   1701  7d0f		       29 03		      and	#%11	;2
   1702  7d11		       d0 0c		      bne	nothingAnimates	;2/3
   1703  7d13
   1704  7d13		       a5 9c		      lda	scrollBits	;3
   1705  7d15		       d0 08		      bne	nothingAnimates	;2/3		 DON'T animate if we scrolled
   1706  7d17
   1707  7d17		       ad d8 f2 	      lda	ANIM_DIAMOND	;4
   1708  7d1a		       49 01		      eor	#CHARACTER_DIAMOND^CHARACTER_DIAMOND2	;2
   1709  7d1c		       8d d8 f6 	      sta	ANIM_DIAMOND + RAM_WRITE	;4 = 15	 diamond
   1710  7d1f
   1711  7d1f		       4c 28 f2    nothingAnimates jmp	retAnim	;3
   1712  7d22
   1713  7d22							;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
   1714  7d22
      0  7d22					      DEFINE_SUBROUTINE	ScoreAdd
      1  7d22		       00 0f	   BANK_ScoreAdd =	_CURRENT_BANK
      2  7d22					      SUBROUTINE
      3  7d22				   ScoreAdd
   1716  7d22							; TJ: used by:
   1717  7d22							; - BANK_INITBANK.asm
   1718  7d22		       a2 09		      ldx	#BANK_SCORING
   1719  7d24		       86 3e		      stx	SET_BANK_RAM
   1720  7d26		       20 0f f2 	      jsr	UpdateScore
   1721  7d29		       a5 c3	   rbret      lda	ROM_Bank
   1722  7d2b		       85 3f		      sta	SET_BANK
   1723  7d2d		       60		      rts
   1724  7d2e
   1725  7d2e							;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
   1726  7d2e
      0  7d2e					      DEFINE_SUBROUTINE	nextLevelMan
      1  7d2e		       00 0f	   BANK_nextLevelMan =	_CURRENT_BANK
      2  7d2e					      SUBROUTINE
      3  7d2e				   nextLevelMan
   1728  7d2e							; TJ: used by:
   1729  7d2e							; - BANK_INITBANK.asm
   1730  7d2e		       a9 03		      lda	#BANK_NextCave
   1731  7d30		       85 3f		      sta	SET_BANK
   1732  7d32		       4c b3 f4 	      jmp	NextCave
   1733  7d35
   1734  7d35							;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
   1735  7d35
      0  7d35					      DEFINE_SUBROUTINE	SortObjects2	;=128(A), minimum 15 @ segtime exit
      1  7d35		       00 0f	   BANK_SortObjects2 =	_CURRENT_BANK
      2  7d35					      SUBROUTINE
      3  7d35				   SortObjects2
   1737  7d35							; TJ: used by:
   1738  7d35							; - BANK_FIXED.asm
   1739  7d35
   1740  7d35		       ad 84 02 	      lda	INTIM	;4
   1741  7d38		       c9 03		      cmp	#MINIMUM_SORT_TIME	;2
   1742  7d3a		       90 4d		      bcc	.sortExit	;2(3)=8	insufficient time
      0  7d3c					      STRESS_TIME	MINIMUM_SORT_TIME
      1  7d3c				  -	      IF	TEST_MINIMUM_SORT_TIME = 1
      2  7d3c				  -
      3  7d3c				  -
      4  7d3c				  -
      5  7d3c				  -
      6  7d3c				  -
      7  7d3c				  -	      echo	"***** WARNING! STRESS_TIME enabled @", ., "! *****"
      8  7d3c				  -	      bne	. - 7
      9  7d3c					      ENDIF
   1744  7d3c
   1745  7d3c		       a6 8a		      ldx	ObjStackNum	;3
   1746  7d3e		       bd 3b fa 	      lda	BankObjStack,x	;4
   1747  7d41		       85 3e		      sta	SET_BANK_RAM	;3
   1748  7d43		       4c 81 fd 	      jmp	.enterSort	;3 = 13
   1749  7d46
   1750  7d46				   restartSort		;  = 11
   1751  7d46
   1752  7d46							; So there's another sort 'starting' and we reset the ptr to the end of the obj list
   1753  7d46
   1754  7d46							; retrieve size of list to sort
   1755  7d46		       a9 ff		      lda	#<(-1)	;2
   1756  7d48		       85 d3		      sta	sortRequired	;3		 flag that we're DOING it
   1757  7d4a
   1758  7d4a		       a6 8a		      ldx	ObjStackNum	;3
   1759  7d4c		       b4 8b		      ldy	ObjStackPtr,x	;4		 index of 1st free slot = # slots in use
   1760  7d4e		       88		      dey		;2
   1761  7d4f		       84 d4		      sty	sortPtr	;3		 earlier potential swappable object
   1762  7d51		       f0 36		      beq	.sortExit	;2/3
   1763  7d53
   1764  7d53				   midSort		;  =  6
   1765  7d53
   1766  7d53		       b9 80 11 	      lda	SortedObjPtr,y	;4		 y = sortPtr!
   1767  7d56		       be 7f 11 	      ldx	SortedObjPtr-1,y	;4		 the 'current' object looking to be sorted correctly
   1768  7d59		       a8		      tay		;2
   1769  7d5a
   1770  7d5a		       bd 80 10 	      lda	ObjStackY,x	;4
   1771  7d5d		       d9 80 10 	      cmp	ObjStackY,y	;4
   1772  7d60		       90 16		      bcc	earlierObject	;2(3)
   1773  7d62		       d0 08		      bne	swapAround	;2(3)
   1774  7d64
   1775  7d64		       b9 00 10 	      lda	ObjStackX,y	;4
   1776  7d67		       dd 00 10 	      cmp	ObjStackX,x	;4
   1777  7d6a		       b0 0c		      bcs	earlierObject	;2(3)		 WE DO NOT WANT TO SWAP IF == OTHERWISE LOCKUP
   1778  7d6c
   1779  7d6c				   swapAround		;   = 32 max.
   1780  7d6c		       98		      tya		;2		 y = SortedObjPtr[sortPtr]
   1781  7d6d		       a4 d4		      ldy	sortPtr	;3
   1782  7d6f		       99 7f 15 	      sta	SortedObjPtr+RAM_WRITE-1,y	;5
   1783  7d72		       8a		      txa		;2		 x = SortedObjPtr[sortPtr-1]
   1784  7d73		       99 80 15 	      sta	SortedObjPtr+RAM_WRITE,y	;5
   1785  7d76		       84 d3		      sty	sortRequired	;3 = 20	 as we've done a swap, ensure another pass (ANY non-neg value)
   1786  7d78
   1787  7d78		       c6 d4	   earlierObject dec	sortPtr	;5 =  5	 look at earlier object
   1788  7d7a
   1789  7d7a		       ad 84 02 	      lda	INTIM	;4
   1790  7d7d		       c9 03		      cmp	#MINIMUM_SORT_TIME	;2
   1791  7d7f		       90 08		      bcc	.sortExit	;2(3)=8	insufficient time
      0  7d81					      STRESS_TIME	MINIMUM_SORT_TIME
      1  7d81				  -	      IF	TEST_MINIMUM_SORT_TIME = 1
      2  7d81				  -
      3  7d81				  -
      4  7d81				  -
      5  7d81				  -
      6  7d81				  -
      7  7d81				  -	      echo	"***** WARNING! STRESS_TIME enabled @", ., "! *****"
      8  7d81				  -	      bne	. - 7
      9  7d81					      ENDIF
   1793  7d81							; loop max: 71 cycles, + 15 for exit + overhead outside
   1794  7d81							; -> MINIMUM_SORT_TIME = ceiling(86/64)+1 = 3
   1795  7d81							; TJ: I do not count the 1st INTIM, that's why I have 4 cylces less.
   1796  7d81				   .enterSort
   1797  7d81		       a4 d4		      ldy	sortPtr	;3		 sort 'stops' when potential swappable objects run out
   1798  7d83		       d0 ce		      bne	midSort	;2(3)=5
   1799  7d85		       a5 d3		      lda	sortRequired	;3		 AND there were no more sort requests
   1800  7d87		       10 bd		      bpl	restartSort	;2(3)=5
   1801  7d89
   1802  7d89		       60	   .sortExit  rts		;6		 completed sort! (or time exit)
   1803  7d8a
   1804  7d8a
   1805  7d8a							;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
   1806  7d8a
      0  7d8a					      DEFINE_SUBROUTINE	goGeneralScoringSetups
      1  7d8a		       00 0f	   BANK_goGeneralScoringSetups =	_CURRENT_BANK
      2  7d8a					      SUBROUTINE
      3  7d8a				   goGeneralScoringSetups
   1808  7d8a							; TJ: used by:
   1809  7d8a							; - BANK_INITBANK.asm
   1810  7d8a		       a9 09		      lda	#BANK_SCORING
   1811  7d8c		       85 3e		      sta	SET_BANK_RAM
   1812  7d8e		       20 ae f2 	      jsr	GeneralScoringSetups
   1813  7d91		       a5 c3		      lda	ROM_Bank
   1814  7d93		       85 3f		      sta	SET_BANK
   1815  7d95		       60		      rts
   1816  7d96
   1817  7d96
   1818  7d96							;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
   1819  7d96
      0  7d96					      DEFINE_SUBROUTINE	CopyROM2RAM_F000

      3  7d96				   CopyROM2RAM_F000
   1821  7d96							; TJ: used by:

   1823  7d96

   1825  7d98		       85 3f		      sta	SET_BANK
   1826  7d9a		       85 c3		      sta	ROM_Bank
   1827  7d9c		       4c 43 f0 	      jmp	CopyROMShadowToRAM_F000

      0  7d9f					      include	"BOX.asm"	; 2 * LINES_PER_CHAR bytes

     15  7dbb		       00 00 00 00*	      .byte.b	%00000000,%00000000,%00000000,%00000000,%00000000,%00000000,%00000000	;G
     16  7dc2		       ff ff 99 99*	      .byte.b	%11111111,%11111111,%10011001,%10011001,%10011001,%11111111,%11111111	;B

------- FILE BANK_FIXED.asm
------- FILE Steel_Wall.asm LEVEL 3 PASS 3
      0  7df3					      include	"Steel_Wall.asm"	; 2 * LINES_PER_CHAR bytes
      1  7df3							;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
      0  7df3					      OPTIONAL_PAGEBREAK	"CHARACTERSHAPE_STEEL", LINES_PER_CHAR
 PAGE BREAK INSERTED FOR  CHARACTERSHAPE_STEEL
 REQUESTED SIZE =  $15
 WASTED SPACE =  $d
 PAGEBREAK LOCATION =  $fe00
     10  7e00					      LIST	ON
      3  7e00				   CHARACTERSHAPE_STEEL
      4  7e00				   CHARACTERSHAPE_EXITDOOR
      5  7e00				  -	      if	MIRRORED_STEEL = NO
      6  7e00				  -CHARACTERSHAPE_STEEL_MIRRORED
      7  7e00				  -CHARACTERSHAPE_EXITDOOR_MIRRORED
      8  7e00					      endif
      9  7e00		       00 11 00 00*	      .byte.b	%00000000,%00010001,%00000000,%00000000,%01000100,%00000000,%00000000	;R
     10  7e07		       ff ff ee ff*	      .byte.b	%11111111,%11111111,%11101110,%11111111,%11111111,%10111011,%11111111	;G
     11  7e0e		       ff ff ee ff*	      .byte.b	%11111111,%11111111,%11101110,%11111111,%11111111,%10111011,%11111111	;B
     12  7e15
     13  7e15							;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
     14  7e15					      if	MIRRORED_STEEL = YES

     19  7e1c		       ff ff 77 ff*	      .byte.b	%11111111,%11111111,%01110111,%11111111,%11111111,%11011101,%11111111	;G
     20  7e23		       ff ff 77 ff*	      .byte.b	%11111111,%11111111,%01110111,%11111111,%11111111,%11011101,%11111111	;B
     21  7e2a					      endif
------- FILE BANK_FIXED.asm
   1836  7e2a							;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
   1837  7e2a
   1838  7e2a
 FREE BYTES IN FIXED BANK =  $1d1
   1839  7e2a					      ECHO	"FREE BYTES IN FIXED BANK = ", $FFFB - *
   1840  7e2a
   1841  7e2a							;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
   1842  7e2a							; The reset vectors
   1843  7e2a							; these must live in the fixed bank (last 2K of any ROM image in TigerVision)
   1844  7e2a
   1845  8000 ????				      SEG	InterruptVectors
   1846  7ffc					      ORG	FIXED_BANK + $7FC
   1847  7ffc					      RORG	$7ffC
   1848  7ffc
   1849  7ffc							;		 .word Reset	       ; NMI	    (not used)
   1850  7ffc		       5b fb		      .word.w	Reset	; RESET
   1851  7ffe		       5b fb		      .word.w	Reset	; IRQ	      (not used)
   1852  8000
   1853  8000							;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
